00001 // CLASSIFICATION: UNCLASSIFIED
00002 
00003 /***************************************************************************/
00004 /* RSC IDENTIFIER: Datum Library Implementation
00005  *
00006  * ABSTRACT
00007  *
00008  *    This component provides datum shifts for a large collection of local
00009  *    datums, WGS72, and WGS84.  A particular datum can be accessed by using its
00010  *    standard 5-letter code to find its index in the datum table.  The index
00011  *    can then be used to retrieve the name, type, ellipsoid code, and datum
00012  *    shift parameters, and to perform shifts to or from that datum.
00013  *
00014  *    By sequentially retrieving all of the datum codes and/or names, a menu
00015  *    of the available datums can be constructed.  The index values resulting
00016  *    from selections from this menu can then be used to access the parameters
00017  *    of the selected datum, or to perform datum shifts involving that datum.
00018  *
00019  *    This component supports both 3-parameter local datums, for which only X,
00020  *    Y, and Z translations relative to WGS 84 have been defined, and
00021  *    7-parameter local datums, for which X, Y, and Z rotations, and a scale
00022  *    factor, are also defined.  It also includes entries for WGS 84 (with an
00023  *    index of 0), and WGS 72 (with an index of 1), but no shift parameter
00024  *    values are defined for these.
00025  *
00026  *    This component provides datum shift functions for both geocentric and
00027  *    geodetic coordinates.  WGS84 is used as an intermediate state when
00028  *    shifting from one local datum to another.  When geodetic coordinates are
00029  *    given Molodensky's method is used, except near the poles where the 3-step
00030  *    step method is used instead.  Specific algorithms are used for shifting
00031  *    between WGS72 and WGS84.
00032  *
00033  *    This component depends on two data files, named 3_param.dat and
00034  *    7_param.dat, which contain the datum parameter values.  Copies of these
00035  *    files must be located in the directory specified by the value of the
00036  *    environment variable "MSPCCS_DATA", if defined, or else in the current
00037  *    directory whenever a program containing this component is executed.
00038  *
00039  *    Additional datums can be added to these files, either manually or using
00040  *    the Create_Datum function.  However, if a large number of datums are
00041  *    added, the datum table array sizes in this component will have to be
00042  *    increased.
00043  *
00044  *    This component depends on two other components: the Ellipsoid component
00045  *    for access to ellipsoid parameters; and the Geocentric component for
00046  *    conversions between geodetic and geocentric coordinates.
00047  *
00048  * ERROR HANDLING
00049  *
00050  *    This component checks for input file errors and input parameter errors.
00051  *    If an invalid value is found, the error code is combined with the current
00052  *    error code using the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error
00053  *    codes to be returned. The possible error codes are:
00054  *
00055  *  DATUM_NO_ERROR                  : No errors occurred in function
00056  *  DATUM_NOT_INITIALIZED_ERROR     : Datum module has not been initialized
00057  *  DATUM_7PARAM_FILE_OPEN_ERROR    : 7 parameter file opening error
00058  *  DATUM_7PARAM_FILE_PARSING_ERROR : 7 parameter file structure error
00059  *  DATUM_7PARAM_OVERFLOW_ERROR     : 7 parameter table overflow
00060  *  DATUM_3PARAM_FILE_OPEN_ERROR    : 3 parameter file opening error
00061  *  DATUM_3PARAM_FILE_PARSING_ERROR : 3 parameter file structure error
00062  *  DATUM_3PARAM_OVERFLOW_ERROR     : 3 parameter table overflow
00063  *  DATUM_INVALID_INDEX_ERROR       : Index out of valid range (less than one
00064  *                                      or more than Number_of_Datums)
00065  *  DATUM_INVALID_SRC_INDEX_ERROR   : Source datum index invalid
00066  *  DATUM_INVALID_DEST_INDEX_ERROR  : Destination datum index invalid
00067  *  DATUM_INVALID_CODE_ERROR        : Datum code not found in table
00068  *  DATUM_LAT_ERROR                 : Latitude out of valid range (-90 to 90)
00069  *  DATUM_LON_ERROR                 : Longitude out of valid range (-180 to
00070  *                                    360)
00071  *  DATUM_SIGMA_ERROR               : Standard error values must be positive
00072  *                                    (or -1 if unknown)
00073  *  DATUM_DOMAIN_ERROR              : Domain of validity not well defined
00074  *  DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR             : Error in ellipsoid module
00075  *  DATUM_NOT_USERDEF_ERROR         : Datum code is not user defined - cannot
00076  *                                    be deleted
00077  *
00078  *
00079  * REUSE NOTES
00080  *
00081  *    Datum is intended for reuse by any application that needs access to
00082  *    datum shift parameters relative to WGS 84.
00083  *
00084  *
00085  * REFERENCES
00086  *
00087  *    Further information on Datum can be found in the Reuse Manual.
00088  *
00089  *    Datum originated from :  U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center (USATEC)
00090  *                             Geospatial Information Division (GID)
00091  *                             7701 Telegraph Road
00092  *                             Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00093  *
00094  * LICENSES
00095  *
00096  *    None apply to this component.
00097  *
00098  * RESTRICTIONS
00099  *
00100  *    Datum has no restrictions.
00101  *
00102  * ENVIRONMENT
00103  *
00104  *    Datum was tested and certified in the following environments:
00105  *
00106  *    1. Solaris 2.5 with GCC 2.8.1
00107  *    2. MS Windows 95 with MS Visual C++ 6
00108  *
00109  * MODIFICATIONS
00110  *
00111  *    Date              Description
00112  *    ----              -----------
00113  *    03/30/97          Original Code
00114  *    05/28/99          Added user-definable datums (for JMTK)
00115  *                      Added datum domain of validity checking (for JMTK)
00116  *                      Added datum shift accuracy calculation (for JMTK)
00117  *    06/27/06          Moved data files to data directory
00118  *    03-14-07          Original C++ Code
00119  *    03-21-08          Added check for west, east longitude values > 180
00120  */
00121 
00122

00169 const double SECONDS_PER_RADIAN = 206264.8062471;   /* Seconds in a radian */
00170 const double PI = 3.14159265358979323e0;
00171 const double PI_OVER_2 = (PI / 2.0);
00172 const double PI_OVER_180 = (PI / 180.0);
00173 const double _180_OVER_PI = (180.0 / PI);
00174 const double TWO_PI = (2.0 * PI);
00175 const double MIN_LAT = (-PI/2.0);
00176 const double MAX_LAT = (+PI/2.0);
00177 const double MIN_LON = -PI;
00178 const double MAX_LON = (2.0 * PI);
00179 const int DATUM_CODE_LENGTH = 7;
00180 const int DATUM_NAME_LENGTH = 33;
00181 const int ELLIPSOID_CODE_LENGTH = 3;
00182 const int MAX_7PARAM = 25;
00183 const int MAX_3PARAM = 250;
00184 const int MAX_WGS = 2;
00185 const double MOLODENSKY_MAX = (89.75 * PI_OVER_180); /* Polar limit */
00186 const int FILENAME_LENGTH = 128;
00187 const char *WGS84_Datum_Code = "WGE";
00188 const char *WGS72_Datum_Code = "WGC";

00191 /************************************************************************/
00192 /*                              LOCAL FUNCTIONS     
00193  *
00194  */
00195 
00196 GeodeticCoordinates* molodenskyShift( const double a, const double da, const double f, const double df,
00197                       const double dx, const double dy, const double dz,
00198                       const double sourceLongitude, const double sourceLatitude, const double sourceHeight )
00199 
00200 { 
00201 /*
00202  *  The function molodenskyShift shifts geodetic coordinates using the Molodensky method.
00203  *
00204  *    a               : Semi-major axis of source ellipsoid in meters  (input)
00205  *    da              : Destination a minus source a                   (input)
00206  *    f               : Flattening of source ellipsoid                 (input)
00207  *    df              : Destination f minus source f                   (input)
00208  *    dx              : X coordinate shift in meters                   (input)
00209  *    dy              : Y coordinate shift in meters                   (input)
00210  *    dz              : Z coordinate shift in meters                   (input)
00211  *    sourceLongitude : Longitude in radians                           (input)
00212  *    sourceLatitude  : Latitude in radians.                           (input)
00213  *    sourceHeight    : Height in meters.                              (input)
00214  *    targetLongitude : Calculated longitude in radians.               (output)
00215  *    targetLatitude  : Calculated latitude in radians.                (output)
00216  *    targetHeight    : Calculated height in meters.                   (output)
00217  */
00218 
00219   double tLon_in;   /* temp longitude                                     */
00220   double e2;        /* Intermediate calculations for dp, dl               */
00221   double ep2;       /* Intermediate calculations for dp, dl               */
00222   double sin_Lat;   /* sin(Latitude_1)                                    */
00223   double sin2_Lat;  /* (sin(Latitude_1))^2                                */
00224   double sin_Lon;   /* sin(Longitude_1)                                   */
00225   double cos_Lat;   /* cos(Latitude_1)                                    */
00226   double cos_Lon;   /* cos(Longitude_1)                                   */
00227   double w2;        /* Intermediate calculations for dp, dl               */
00228   double w;         /* Intermediate calculations for dp, dl               */
00229   double w3;        /* Intermediate calculations for dp, dl               */
00230   double m;         /* Intermediate calculations for dp, dl               */
00231   double n;         /* Intermediate calculations for dp, dl               */
00232   double dp;        /* Delta phi                                          */
00233   double dp1;       /* Delta phi calculations                             */
00234   double dp2;       /* Delta phi calculations                             */
00235   double dp3;       /* Delta phi calculations                             */
00236   double dl;        /* Delta lambda                                       */
00237   double dh;        /* Delta height                                       */
00238   double dh1;       /* Delta height calculations                          */
00239   double dh2;       /* Delta height calculations                          */
00240 
00241   if (sourceLongitude > PI)
00242     tLon_in = sourceLongitude - TWO_PI;
00243   else
00244     tLon_in = sourceLongitude;
00245 
00246   e2 = 2 * f - f * f;
00247   ep2 = e2 / (1 - e2);
00248   sin_Lat = sin(sourceLatitude);
00249   cos_Lat = cos(sourceLatitude);
00250   sin_Lon = sin(tLon_in);
00251   cos_Lon = cos(tLon_in);
00252   sin2_Lat = sin_Lat * sin_Lat;
00253   w2 = 1.0 - e2 * sin2_Lat;
00254   w = sqrt(w2);
00255   w3 = w * w2;
00256   m = (a * (1.0 - e2)) / w3;
00257   n = a / w;
00258   dp1 = cos_Lat * dz - sin_Lat * cos_Lon * dx - sin_Lat * sin_Lon * dy;
00259   dp2 = ((e2 * sin_Lat * cos_Lat) / w) * da;
00260   dp3 = sin_Lat * cos_Lat * (2.0 * n + ep2 * m * sin2_Lat) * (1.0 - f) * df;
00261   dp = (dp1 + dp2 + dp3) / (m + sourceHeight);
00262   dl = (-sin_Lon * dx + cos_Lon * dy) / ((n + sourceHeight) * cos_Lat);
00263   dh1 = (cos_Lat * cos_Lon * dx) + (cos_Lat * sin_Lon * dy) + (sin_Lat * dz);
00264   dh2 = -(w * da) + ((a * (1 - f)) / w) * sin2_Lat * df;
00265   dh = dh1 + dh2;
00266 
00267   double targetLatitude = sourceLatitude + dp;
00268   double targetLongitude = sourceLongitude + dl;
00269   double targetHeight = sourceHeight + dh;
00270   
00271   if (targetLongitude > TWO_PI)
00272     targetLongitude -= TWO_PI;
00273   if (targetLongitude < (- PI))
00274     targetLongitude += TWO_PI;
00275 
00276   return new GeodeticCoordinates( CoordinateType::geodetic, targetLongitude, targetLatitude, targetHeight );
00277 }

00300 // Make this class a singleton, so the data files are only initialized once
00301 DatumLibraryImplementation* DatumLibraryImplementation::instance = 0;
00302 int DatumLibraryImplementation::instanceCount = 0;
00303 
00304 
00305 DatumLibraryImplementation* DatumLibraryImplementation::getInstance()
00306 {
00307   if( instance == 0 )
00308     instance = new DatumLibraryImplementation;
00309 
00310   instanceCount++;
00311 
00312   return instance;
00313 }

00315 
00316 void DatumLibraryImplementation::removeInstance()
00317 {
00318 /*
00319  * The function removeInstance removes this DatumLibraryImplementation instance from the
00320  * total number of instances. 
00321  */
00322   if( --instanceCount < 1 )
00323   {
00324     deleteInstance();
00325   }
00326 }
00327 
00328 
00329 void DatumLibraryImplementation::deleteInstance()
00330 {
00331 /*
00332  * Delete the singleton.
00333  */
00334 
00335   if( instance != 0 )
00336   {
00337     delete instance;
00338     instance = 0;
00339   }
00340 }

00343 DatumLibraryImplementation::DatumLibraryImplementation():
00344   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation( 0 ),
00345   datum3ParamCount( 0 ),
00346   datum7ParamCount( 0 )
00347 {
00348 /*
00349  * The constructor creates an empty list to store the datum information
00350  *  contained in two external files, 3_param.dat and 7_param.dat.  
00351  */
00352 
00353   datumList.reserve( 2 + MAX_3PARAM + MAX_7PARAM );
00354 
00355   loadDatums();
00356 }

00358 
00359 DatumLibraryImplementation::DatumLibraryImplementation( const DatumLibraryImplementation &dl )
00360 {
00361   int size = dl.datumList.size();
00362   for( int i = 0; i < size; i++ )
00363   {
00364     switch( dl.datumList[i]->datumType() )
00365     {
00366       case DatumType::threeParamDatum:
00367         datumList.push_back( new ThreeParameterDatum( *( ( ThreeParameterDatum* )( dl.datumList[i] ) ) ) );
00368         break;
00369       case DatumType::sevenParamDatum:
00370         datumList.push_back( new SevenParameterDatum( *( ( SevenParameterDatum* )( dl.datumList[i] ) ) ) );
00371         break;
00372       case DatumType::wgs84Datum:
00373       case DatumType::wgs72Datum:
00374         datumList.push_back( new Datum( *( dl.datumList[i] ) ) );
00375         break;
00376     }
00377   }
00378 
00379   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation = dl._ellipsoidLibraryImplementation;
00380   datum3ParamCount = dl.datum3ParamCount;
00381   datum7ParamCount = dl.datum7ParamCount;
00382 }
00383 
00384 
00385 DatumLibraryImplementation::~DatumLibraryImplementation()
00386 {
00387   std::vector<Datum*>::iterator iter = datumList.begin();
00388   while( iter != datumList.end() )
00389         {
00390                 delete( *iter );
00391     iter++;
00392         }
00393   datumList.clear();
00394 
00395   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation = 0;
00396 }
00397 
00398 
00399 DatumLibraryImplementation& DatumLibraryImplementation::operator=( const DatumLibraryImplementation &dl )
00400 {
00401   if ( &dl == this )
00402           return *this;
00403 
00404   int size = dl.datumList.size();
00405   for( int i = 0; i < size; i++ )
00406   {
00407     switch( dl.datumList[i]->datumType() )
00408     {
00409       case DatumType::threeParamDatum:
00410         datumList.push_back( new ThreeParameterDatum( *( ( ThreeParameterDatum* )( dl.datumList[i] ) ) ) );
00411         break;
00412       case DatumType::sevenParamDatum:
00413         datumList.push_back( new SevenParameterDatum( *( ( SevenParameterDatum* )( dl.datumList[i] ) ) ) );
00414         break;
00415       case DatumType::wgs84Datum:
00416       case DatumType::wgs72Datum:
00417         datumList.push_back( new Datum( *( dl.datumList[i] ) ) );
00418         break;
00419     }
00420   }
00421 
00422   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation = dl._ellipsoidLibraryImplementation;
00423   datum3ParamCount = dl.datum3ParamCount;
00424   datum7ParamCount = dl.datum7ParamCount;
00425 
00426   return *this;
00427 }

00429 
00430 void DatumLibraryImplementation::define3ParamDatum( const char *code, const char *name, const char *ellipsoidCode, 
00431                                       double deltaX, double deltaY, double deltaZ,
00432                                       double sigmaX, double sigmaY, double sigmaZ, 
00433                                       double westLongitude, double eastLongitude, double southLatitude, double northLatitude )
00434 { 
00435 /*
00436  * The function define3ParamDatum creates a new local (3-parameter) datum with the
00437  * specified code, name, and axes.  If the datum table has not been initialized,
00438  * the specified code is already in use, or a new version of the 3-param.dat
00439  * file cannot be created, an exception is thrown.
00440  * Note that the indexes of all datums in the datum table may be
00441  * changed by this function.
00442  *
00443  *   code          : 5-letter new datum code.                      (input)
00444  *   name          : Name of the new datum                         (input)
00445  *   ellipsoidCode : 2-letter code for the associated ellipsoid    (input)
00446  *   deltaX        : X translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00447  *   deltaY        : Y translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00448  *   deltaZ        : Z translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00449  *   sigmaX        : Standard error in X in meters                 (input)
00450  *   sigmaY        : Standard error in Y in meters                 (input)
00451  *   sigmaZ        : Standard error in Z in meters                 (input)
00452  *   westLongitude : Western edge of validity rectangle in radians (input)
00453  *   eastLongitude : Eastern edge of validity rectangle in radians (input)
00454  *   southLatitude : Southern edge of validity rectangle in radians(input)
00455  *   northLatitude : Northern edge of validity rectangle in radians(input)
00456  */
00457 
00458   char datum_Code[DATUM_CODE_LENGTH];
00459   long index = 0;
00460   long ellipsoid_index = 0;
00461   long code_length = 0;
00462   char *PathName = NULL;
00463   FILE *fp_3param = NULL;
00464   char errorStatus[256] = "";
00465 
00466   if (!(datum3ParamCount < MAX_3PARAM))
00467     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::datumOverflow );
00468   if (!(((sigmaX > 0.0) || (sigmaX == -1.0)) &&
00469         ((sigmaY > 0.0) || (sigmaY == -1.0)) &&
00470         ((sigmaZ > 0.0) || (sigmaZ == -1.0))))
00471     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::datumSigma );
00472 
00473   if ((southLatitude < MIN_LAT) || (southLatitude > MAX_LAT))
00474     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::latitude );
00475   if ((westLongitude < MIN_LON) || (westLongitude > MAX_LON))
00476     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::longitude );
00477   if ((northLatitude < MIN_LAT) || (northLatitude > MAX_LAT))
00478     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::latitude );
00479   if ((eastLongitude < MIN_LON) || (eastLongitude > MAX_LON))
00480     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::longitude );
00481   if (southLatitude >= northLatitude)
00482     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::datumDomain );
00483   if ((westLongitude >= eastLongitude) && (westLongitude >= 0 && westLongitude < 180) && (eastLongitude >= 0 && eastLongitude < 180))
00484     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::datumDomain );
00485 
00486   try
00487   {
00488     datumIndex( code, &index );
00489     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::invalidDatumCode );
00490   }
00491   catch(CoordinateConversionException e)
00492   {
00493   }
00494 
00495   code_length = strlen( code );
00496 
00497   if( code_length > ( DATUM_CODE_LENGTH-1 ) )
00498     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::invalidDatumCode );
00499 
00500   if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation )
00501   {
00502     _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( ellipsoidCode, &ellipsoid_index );
00503   //  if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( ellipsoidCode, &ellipsoid_index ) )
00504   //    errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;
00505   }
00506   else
00507     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::ellipse );
00508 
00509   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00510     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00511 
00512   strcpy( datum_Code, code );
00513   /* Convert code to upper case */
00514   for( long i = 0; i < code_length; i++ )
00515     datum_Code[i] = ( char )toupper( datum_Code[i] );
00516 
00517   int numDatums = datumList.size();
00518   datumList.push_back( new ThreeParameterDatum( numDatums, ( char* )datum_Code, ( char* )ellipsoidCode, ( char* )name, DatumType::threeParamDatum, deltaX, deltaY, deltaZ, 
00519                                                 westLongitude, eastLongitude, southLatitude, northLatitude, sigmaX, sigmaY, sigmaZ, true ) );
00520   datum3ParamCount++;
00521 
00522   write3ParamFile();
00523 } 
00524 
00525 
00526 void DatumLibraryImplementation::define7ParamDatum( const char *code, const char *name, const char *ellipsoidCode, 
00527                                       double deltaX, double deltaY, double deltaZ,
00528                                       double rotationX, double rotationY, double rotationZ, 
00529                                       double scale )
00530 { 
00531 /*
00532  * The function define7ParamDatum creates a new local (7-parameter) datum with the
00533  * specified code, name, and axes.  If the datum table has not been initialized,
00534  * the specified code is already in use, or a new version of the 7-param.dat
00535  * file cannot be created, an exception is thrown.
00536  * Note that the indexes of all datums in the datum table may be
00537  * changed by this function.
00538  *
00539  *   code          : 5-letter new datum code.                      (input)
00540  *   name          : Name of the new datum                         (input)
00541  *   ellipsoidCode : 2-letter code for the associated ellipsoid    (input)
00542  *   deltaX        : X translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00543  *   deltaY        : Y translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00544  *   deltaZ        : Z translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00545  *   rotationX     : X rotation to WGS84 in arc seconds            (input)
00546  *   rotationY     : Y rotation to WGS84 in arc seconds            (input)
00547  *   rotationZ     : Z rotation to WGS84 in arc seconds            (input)
00548  *   scale         : Scale factor                                  (input)
00549  */
00550 
00551   char datum_Code[DATUM_CODE_LENGTH];
00552   long index = 0;
00553   long ellipsoid_index = 0;
00554   long code_length = 0;
00555   char *PathName = NULL;
00556   FILE *fp_7param = NULL;
00557   char errorStatus[256] = "";
00558 
00559   if (!(datum7ParamCount < MAX_7PARAM))
00560     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::datumOverflow );
00561 
00562   if ((rotationX < -60.0) || (rotationX > 60.0))
00563     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::datumRotation );
00564   if ((rotationY < -60.0) || (rotationY > 60.0))
00565     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::datumRotation );
00566   if ((rotationZ < -60.0) || (rotationZ > 60.0))
00567     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::datumRotation );
00568 
00569   if ((scale < -0.001) || (scale > 0.001))
00570     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::scaleFactor );
00571 
00572   try
00573   {
00574     datumIndex( code, &index );
00575     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::invalidDatumCode );
00576   }
00577   catch(CoordinateConversionException e)
00578   {
00579   }
00580 
00581   code_length = strlen( code );
00582   if( code_length > ( DATUM_CODE_LENGTH-1 ) )
00583     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::invalidDatumCode );
00584 
00585   if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation )
00586   {
00587     _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( ellipsoidCode, &ellipsoid_index );
00588   //  if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( ellipsoidCode, &ellipsoid_index ) )
00589   //    errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;
00590   }
00591   else
00592     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::ellipse );
00593 
00594   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00595     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00596 
00597   long i;
00598   strcpy( datum_Code, code );
00599   /* Convert code to upper case */
00600   for( i = 0; i < code_length; i++ )
00601     datum_Code[i] = ( char )toupper( datum_Code[i] );
00602 
00603   datumList.insert( datumList.begin() + MAX_WGS + datum7ParamCount, new SevenParameterDatum( datum7ParamCount, ( char* )datum_Code, ( char* )ellipsoidCode, ( char* )name, DatumType::sevenParamDatum, deltaX, deltaY, deltaZ, 
00604                                                 0, 0, 0, 0, rotationX / SECONDS_PER_RADIAN, rotationY / SECONDS_PER_RADIAN, rotationZ / SECONDS_PER_RADIAN, scale, true ) );
00605   datum7ParamCount++;
00606 
00607   write7ParamFile();
00608 } 
00609 
00610 
00611 void DatumLibraryImplementation::removeDatum( const char* code )
00612 { 
00613 /*
00614  * The function removeDatum deletes a local (3-parameter) datum with the
00615  * specified code.  If the datum table has not been initialized or a new
00616  * version of the 3-param.dat file cannot be created, an exception is thrown,
00617  * Note that the indexes of all datums
00618  * in the datum table may be changed by this function.
00619  *
00620  *   code           : 5-letter datum code.                      (input)
00621  *
00622  */
00623 
00624   char *PathName = NULL;
00625   FILE *fp_3param = NULL;
00626   FILE *fp_7param = NULL;
00627   long index = 0;
00628   bool delete_3param_datum = true;
00629 
00630   datumIndex( code, &index );
00631 
00632   if( datumList[index]->datumType() == DatumType::threeParamDatum )
00633   {
00634     if( !( ( ThreeParameterDatum* )datumList[index] )->userDefined() )
00635       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::notUserDefined );
00636   }
00637   else if( datumList[index]->datumType() == DatumType::sevenParamDatum )
00638   {
00639     delete_3param_datum = false;
00640     if( !( ( SevenParameterDatum* )datumList[index] )->userDefined() )
00641       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::notUserDefined );
00642   }
00643   else
00644     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::notUserDefined );
00645 
00646   long i = 0;
00647   long count = 0;
00648 
00649   int numDatums = datumList.size();
00650   for(i = index; i < numDatums; i++)
00651     datumList[i] = datumList[i+1];
00652 
00653   if( numDatums != ( 2 + MAX_3PARAM + MAX_7PARAM ) )
00654     datumList[i] = datumList[i+1];
00655   else
00656     datumList.erase( datumList.end() - 1 );
00657 
00658   numDatums--;
00659   datumList.resize( numDatums );
00660 
00661   if( !delete_3param_datum )
00662   {
00663     datum7ParamCount--;
00664 
00665     write7ParamFile();
00666   }
00667   else if( delete_3param_datum )
00668   {
00669     datum3ParamCount--;
00670 
00671     write3ParamFile();
00672   }
00673 } 
00674 
00675 
00676 void DatumLibraryImplementation::datumCount( long *count )
00677 { 
00678 /*
00679  *  The function datumCount returns the number of Datums in the table
00680  *  if the table was initialized without error.
00681  *
00682  *  count        : number of datums in the datum table     (output)
00683  */
00684 
00685   *count = datumList.size();
00686 } 
00687 
00688 
00689 void DatumLibraryImplementation::datumIndex( const char *code, long *index )
00690 { 
00691 /*
00692  *  The function datumIndex returns the index of the datum with the
00693  *  specified code.
00694  *
00695  *  code    : The datum code being searched for.                    (input)
00696  *  index   : The index of the datum in the table with the          (output)
00697  *              specified code.
00698  */
00699 
00700   char temp_code[DATUM_CODE_LENGTH];
00701   long length;
00702   long pos = 0;
00703   long i = 0;
00704 
00705   *index = 0;
00706 
00707   if( !code )
00708     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidDatumCode );
00709 
00710   length = strlen( code );
00711   if ( length > ( DATUM_CODE_LENGTH-1 ) )
00712     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidDatumCode );
00713   else
00714   {
00715     strcpy( temp_code, code );
00716 
00717     /* Convert to upper case */
00718     for( i=0; i < length; i++ )
00719       temp_code[i] = ( char )toupper( temp_code[i] );
00720 
00721     /* Strip blank spaces */
00722     while( pos < length )
00723     {
00724       if( isspace( temp_code[pos] ) )
00725       {
00726         for( i=pos; i <= length; i++ )
00727           temp_code[i] = temp_code[i+1];
00728         length -= 1;
00729       }
00730       else
00731         pos += 1;
00732     }
00733 
00734     int numDatums = datumList.size();
00735     /* Search for code */
00736     i = 0;
00737     while( i < numDatums && strcmp( temp_code, datumList[i]->code() ) )
00738     {
00739       i++;
00740     }
00741     if( i == numDatums || strcmp( temp_code, datumList[i]->code() ) )
00742       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidDatumCode );
00743     else
00744       *index = i;
00745   }
00746 } 
00747 
00748 
00749 void DatumLibraryImplementation::datumCode( const long index, char *code )
00750 { 
00751 /*
00752  *  The function datumCode returns the 5-letter code of the datum
00753  *  referenced by index.
00754  *
00755  *  index   : The index of a given datum in the datum table.        (input)
00756  *  code    : The datum Code of the datum referenced by Index.      (output)
00757  */
00758 
00759   if( index < 0 || index >= datumList.size() )
00760     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00761   else
00762     strcpy( code, datumList[index]->code() );
00763 } 
00764

00766 void DatumLibraryImplementation::datumName( const long index, char *name )
00767 {
00768 /*
00769  *  The function datumName returns the name of the datum referenced by
00770  *  index.
00771  *
00772  *  index   : The index of a given datum in the datum table.        (input)
00773  *  name    : The datum Name of the datum referenced by Index.      (output)
00774  */
00775 
00776   if( index < 0 || index >= datumList.size() )
00777     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00778   else
00779     strcpy( name, datumList[index]->name() );
00780 }

00783 void DatumLibraryImplementation::datumEllipsoidCode( const long index, char *code )
00784 { 
00785 /*
00786  *  The function datumEllipsoidCode returns the 2-letter ellipsoid code
00787  *  for the ellipsoid associated with the datum referenced by index.
00788  *
00789  *  index   : The index of a given datum in the datum table.          (input)
00790  *  code    : The ellipsoid code for the ellipsoid associated with    (output)
00791  *               the datum referenced by index.
00792  */
00793 
00794   if( index < 0 || index >= datumList.size() )
00795     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00796   else
00797     strcpy( code, datumList[index]->ellipsoidCode() );
00798 }

00800 
00801 void DatumLibraryImplementation::datumStandardErrors( const long index, double *sigmaX, double *sigmaY, double *sigmaZ )
00802 { 
00803 /*
00804  *   The function datumStandardErrors returns the standard errors in X,Y, & Z
00805  *   for the datum referenced by index.
00806  *
00807  *    index      : The index of a given datum in the datum table   (input)
00808  *    sigma_X    : Standard error in X in meters                   (output)
00809  *    sigma_Y    : Standard error in Y in meters                   (output)
00810  *    sigma_Z    : Standard error in Z in meters                   (output)
00811  */
00812 
00813   if( index < 0 || index >= datumList.size() )
00814     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00815   else
00816   {
00817     Datum* datum = datumList[index];
00818 
00819     if( datum->datumType() == DatumType::threeParamDatum )
00820     {
00821       ThreeParameterDatum* threeParameterDatum = ( ThreeParameterDatum* )datum;
00822       *sigmaX = threeParameterDatum->sigmaX();
00823       *sigmaY = threeParameterDatum->sigmaY();
00824       *sigmaZ = threeParameterDatum->sigmaZ();
00825     }
00826     else
00827       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00828   }
00829 }

00832 void DatumLibraryImplementation::datumSevenParameters( const long index, double *rotationX, double *rotationY, double *rotationZ, double *scaleFactor )
00833 { 
00834 /*
00835  *   The function datumSevenParameters returns parameter values, 
00836  *   used only by a seven parameter datum,
00837  *   for the datum referenced by index.
00838  *
00839  *    index       : The index of a given datum in the datum table. (input)
00840  *    rotationX   : X rotation in radians                          (output)
00841  *    rotationY   : Y rotation in radians                          (output)
00842  *    rotationZ   : Z rotation in radians                          (output)
00843  *    scaleFactor : Scale factor                                   (output)
00844  */
00845 
00846   if( index < 0 || index >= datumList.size() )
00847     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00848   else
00849   {
00850     Datum* datum = datumList[index];
00851 
00852     if( datum->datumType() == DatumType::sevenParamDatum )
00853     {
00854       SevenParameterDatum* sevenParameterDatum = ( SevenParameterDatum* )datum;
00855 
00856       *rotationX = sevenParameterDatum->rotationX();
00857       *rotationY = sevenParameterDatum->rotationY();
00858       *rotationZ = sevenParameterDatum->rotationZ();
00859       *scaleFactor = sevenParameterDatum->scaleFactor();
00860     }
00861     else
00862       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00863   }
00864 }

00868 {
