00890 
00891 
00892 Accuracy* DatumLibraryImplementation::datumShiftError( const long sourceIndex, const long targetIndex, 
00893                                     double longitude, double latitude, Accuracy* sourceAccuracy )
00894 {
00895 /*
00896  *  The function datumShiftError returns the 90% horizontal (circular), vertical (linear), and
00897  *  spherical errors for a shift from the specified source datum to the
00898  *  specified destination datum at the specified location.
00899  *
00900  *  sourceIndex      : Index of source datum                                      (input)
00901  *  targetIndex      : Index of destination datum                                 (input)
00902  *  latitude         : Latitude of point being converted in radians               (input)
00903  *  longitude        : Longitude of point being converted in radians              (input)
00904  *  circularError90  : Combined 90% circular horizontal error in meters           (output)
00905  *  linearError90    : Combined 90% linear vertical error in meters               (output)
00906  *  sphericalError90 : Combined 90% spherical error in meters                     (output)
00907  */
00908 
00909   double sinlat = sin( latitude );
00910   double coslat = cos( latitude );
00911   double sinlon = sin( longitude );
00912   double coslon = cos( longitude );
00913   double sigma_delta_lat;
00914   double sigma_delta_lon;
00915   double sigma_delta_height;
00916   double sx, sy, sz;
00917   double ce90_in = -1.0;
00918   double le90_in = -1.0;
00919   double se90_in = -1.0;
00920   double ce90_out = -1.0;
00921   double le90_out = -1.0;
00922   double se90_out = -1.0;
00923   double circularError90 = sourceAccuracy->circularError90();
00924   double linearError90 = sourceAccuracy->linearError90();
00925   double sphericalError90 = sourceAccuracy->sphericalError90();
00926 
00927   int numDatums = datumList.size();
00928 
00929   if( ( sourceIndex < 0 ) || ( sourceIndex >= numDatums ) )
00930     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00931   if( ( targetIndex < 0 ) || ( targetIndex >= numDatums ) )
00932     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00933   if( ( latitude < ( -90 * PI_OVER_180 ) ) || ( latitude > ( 90 * PI_OVER_180 ) ) )
00934     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::latitude );
00935   if( ( longitude < ( -PI ) ) || ( longitude > TWO_PI ) )
00936     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::longitude );
00937 
00938   if( sourceIndex == targetIndex )
00939   { /* Just copy */
00940     circularError90 = circularError90;
00941     linearError90 = linearError90;
00942     sphericalError90 = sphericalError90;
00943   }
00944   else
00945   {
00946     Datum* sourceDatum = datumList[sourceIndex];
00947     Datum* targetDatum = datumList[targetIndex];
00948 
00949     /* calculate input datum errors */
00950     switch( sourceDatum->datumType() )
00951     {
00952     case DatumType::wgs84Datum:
00953     case DatumType::wgs72Datum:
00954     case DatumType::sevenParamDatum:
00955       {
00956         ce90_in = 0.0;
00957         le90_in = 0.0;
00958         se90_in = 0.0;
00959         break;
00960       }
00961     case DatumType::threeParamDatum:
00962       {
00963         ThreeParameterDatum* sourceThreeParameterDatum = ( ThreeParameterDatum* )sourceDatum;
00964         if( ( sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaX() < 0 )
00965             || ( sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaY() < 0 )
00966             || ( sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaZ() < 0 ) )
00967         {
00968           ce90_in = -1.0;
00969           le90_in = -1.0;
00970           se90_in = -1.0;
00971         }
00972         else
00973         {
00974           sx = sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaX() * sinlat * coslon;
00975           sy = sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaY() * sinlat * sinlon;
00976           sz = sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaZ() * coslat;
00977           sigma_delta_lat = sqrt( ( sx * sx ) + ( sy * sy ) + ( sz * sz ) );
00978 
00979           sx = sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaX() * sinlon;
00980           sy = sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaY() * coslon;
00981           sigma_delta_lon = sqrt( ( sx * sx ) + ( sy * sy ) );
00982 
00983           sx = sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaX() * coslat * coslon;
00984           sy = sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaY() * coslat * sinlon;
00985           sz = sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaZ() * sinlat;
00986           sigma_delta_height = sqrt( ( sx * sx ) + ( sy * sy ) + ( sz * sz ) );
00987 
00988           ce90_in = 2.146 * ( sigma_delta_lat + sigma_delta_lon ) / 2.0;
00989           le90_in = 1.6449 * sigma_delta_height;
00990           se90_in = 2.5003 * ( sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaX() + sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaY() + sourceThreeParameterDatum->sigmaZ() ) / 3.0;
00991         }
00992         break;
00993       }
00994     } 
00995 
00996     /* calculate output datum errors */
00997     switch( targetDatum->datumType() )
00998     {
00999     case DatumType::wgs84Datum:
01000     case DatumType::wgs72Datum:
01001     case DatumType::sevenParamDatum:
01002       {
01003         ce90_out = 0.0;
01004         le90_out = 0.0;
01005         se90_out = 0.0;
01006         break;
01007       }
01008     case DatumType::threeParamDatum:
01009       {
01010         ThreeParameterDatum* targetThreeParameterDatum = ( ThreeParameterDatum* )targetDatum;
01011         if ((targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaX() < 0)
01012             ||(targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaY() < 0)
01013             ||(targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaZ() < 0))
01014         {
01015           ce90_out = -1.0;
01016           le90_out = -1.0;
01017           se90_out = -1.0;
01018         }
01019         else
01020         {
01021           sx = targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaX() * sinlat * coslon;
01022           sy = targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaY() * sinlat * sinlon;
01023           sz = targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaZ() * coslat;
01024           sigma_delta_lat = sqrt((sx * sx) + (sy * sy) + (sz * sz));
01025 
01026           sx = targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaX() * sinlon;
01027           sy = targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaY() * coslon;
01028           sigma_delta_lon = sqrt( ( sx * sx ) + ( sy * sy ) );
01029 
01030           sx = targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaX() * coslat * coslon;
01031           sy = targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaY() * coslat * sinlon;
01032           sz = targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaZ() * sinlat;
01033           sigma_delta_height = sqrt( ( sx * sx ) + ( sy * sy ) + ( sz * sz ) );
01034 
01035           ce90_out = 2.146 * ( sigma_delta_lat + sigma_delta_lon ) / 2.0;
01036           le90_out = 1.6449 * sigma_delta_height;
01037           se90_out = 2.5003 * ( targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaX() + targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaY() + targetThreeParameterDatum->sigmaZ() ) / 3.0;
01038         }
01039         break;
01040       }
01041     } 
01042 
01043     /* combine errors */
01044     if( ( circularError90 < 0.0 ) || ( ce90_in < 0.0 ) || ( ce90_out < 0.0 ) )
01045     {
01046       circularError90 = -1.0;
01047       linearError90 = -1.0;
01048       sphericalError90 = -1.0;
01049     }
01050     else
01051     {
01052       circularError90 = sqrt( ( circularError90 * circularError90 ) + ( ce90_in * ce90_in ) + ( ce90_out * ce90_out ) );
01053       if( circularError90 < 1.0 )
01054       {
01055         circularError90 = 1.0;
01056       }
01057 
01058       if( ( linearError90 < 0.0 ) || ( le90_in < 0.0 ) || ( le90_out < 0.0 ) )
01059       {
01060         linearError90 = -1.0;
01061         sphericalError90 = -1.0;
01062       }
01063       else
01064       {
01065         linearError90 = sqrt( ( linearError90 * linearError90 ) + ( le90_in * le90_in ) + ( le90_out * le90_out ) );
01066         if( linearError90 < 1.0 )
01067         {
01068           linearError90 = 1.0;
01069         }
01070 
01071         if( ( sphericalError90 < 0.0 ) || ( se90_in < 0.0 ) || ( se90_out < 0.0 ) )
01072           sphericalError90 = -1.0;
01073         else
01074         {
01075           sphericalError90 = sqrt( ( sphericalError90 * sphericalError90 ) + ( se90_in * se90_in ) + ( se90_out * se90_out ) );
01076           if( sphericalError90 < 1.0 )
01077           {
01078             sphericalError90 = 1.0;
01079           }
01080         }
01081       }
01082     }
01083   }
01084 
01085   return new Accuracy(circularError90, linearError90, sphericalError90);
01086 }
01087 
01088 
01089 void DatumLibraryImplementation::datumUserDefined( const long index, long *result )
01090 {
01091 /*
01092  *  The function datumUserDefined checks whether or not the specified datum is
01093  *  user defined. It returns 1 if the datum is user defined, and returns
01094  *  0 otherwise. If index is valid DATUM_NO_ERROR is returned, otherwise
01095  *  DATUM_INVALID_INDEX_ERROR is returned.
01096  *
01097  *    index    : Index of a given datum in the datum table (input)
01098  *    result   : Indicates whether specified datum is user defined (1)
01099  *               or not (0)                                (output)
01100  */
01101 
01102   *result = false;
01103 
01104   if( index < 0 || index >= datumList.size() )
01105     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01106   else
01107   {
01108     Datum* datum = datumList[index];
01109 
01110     if( datum->datumType() == DatumType::threeParamDatum )
01111     {
01112       ThreeParameterDatum* threeParameterDatum = ( ThreeParameterDatum* )datum;
01113 
01114       if( threeParameterDatum->userDefined() )
01115         *result = true;
01116     }
01117     else if( datum->datumType() == DatumType::sevenParamDatum )
01118     {
01119       SevenParameterDatum* sevenParamDatum = ( SevenParameterDatum* )datum;
01120 
01121       if( sevenParamDatum->userDefined() )
01122         *result = true;
01123     }
01124     else
01125       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01126   }
01127 } 
01128 
01129 
01130 bool DatumLibraryImplementation::datumUsesEllipsoid( const char *ellipsoidCode )
01131 { 
01132 /*
01133  *  The function datumUsesEllipsoid returns 1 if the ellipsoid is in use by a
01134  *  user defined datum.  Otherwise, 0 is returned.
01135  *
01136  *  ellipsoidCode    : The ellipsoid code being searched for.    (input)
01137  */
01138 
01139   char temp_code[DATUM_CODE_LENGTH];
01140   long length;
01141   long pos = 0;
01142   long i = 0;
01143   bool ellipsoid_in_use = false;
01144 
01145   length = strlen( ellipsoidCode );
01146   if( length <= ( ELLIPSOID_CODE_LENGTH-1 ) )
01147   {
01148     strcpy( temp_code, ellipsoidCode );
01149 
01150     /* Convert to upper case */
01151     for( i=0;i<length;i++ )
01152       temp_code[i] = ( char )toupper( temp_code[i] );
01153 
01154     /* Strip blank spaces */
01155     while( pos < length )
01156     {
01157       if( isspace( temp_code[pos] ) )
01158       {
01159         for( i=pos; i<=length; i++ )
01160           temp_code[i] = temp_code[i+1];
01161         length -= 1;
01162       }
01163       else
01164         pos += 1;
01165     }
01166 
01167     /* Search for code */
01168     i = 0;
01169     int numDatums = datumList.size();
01170     while( ( i < numDatums ) && ( !ellipsoid_in_use ) )
01171     {
01172       if( strcmp( temp_code, datumList[i]->ellipsoidCode() ) == 0 )
01173         ellipsoid_in_use = true;
01174       i++;
01175     }
01176   }
01177 
01178   return ellipsoid_in_use;
01179 } 
01180 
01181 
01182 void DatumLibraryImplementation::datumValidRectangle( const long index, double *westLongitude, double *eastLongitude, double *southLatitude, double *northLatitude )
01183 { 
01184 /*
01185  *   The function datumValidRectangle returns the edges of the validity
01186  *   rectangle for the datum referenced by index.
01187  *
01188  *   index          : The index of a given datum in the datum table   (input)
01189  *   westLongitude : Western edge of validity rectangle in radians   (output)
01190  *   eastLongitude : Eastern edge of validity rectangle in radians   (output)
01191  *   southLatitude : Southern edge of validity rectangle in radians  (output)
01192  *   northLatitude : Northern edge of validity rectangle in radians  (output)
01193  *
01194  */
01195 
01196   if( index < 0 && index >= datumList.size() )
01197     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01198   else
01199   {
01200     *westLongitude = datumList[index]->westLongitude();
01201     *eastLongitude = datumList[index]->eastLongitude();
01202     *southLatitude = datumList[index]->southLatitude();
01203     *northLatitude = datumList[index]->northLatitude();
01204   }
01205 } 
01206 
01207 
01208 CartesianCoordinates* DatumLibraryImplementation::geocentricDatumShift( const long sourceIndex, const double sourceX, const double sourceY, const double sourceZ,
01209                                          const long targetIndex )
01210 { 
01211 /*
01212  *  The function geocentricDatumShift shifts a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative
01213  *  to the source datum to geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative
01214  *  to the destination datum.
01215  *
01216  *  sourceIndex : Index of source datum                      (input)
01217  *  sourceX     : X coordinate relative to source datum      (input)
01218  *  sourceY     : Y coordinate relative to source datum      (input)
01219  *  sourceZ     : Z coordinate relative to source datum      (input)
01220  *  targetIndex : Index of destination datum                 (input)
01221  *  targetX     : X coordinate relative to destination datum (output)
01222  *  targetY     : Y coordinate relative to destination datum (output)
01223  *  targetZ     : Z coordinate relative to destination datum (output)
01224  *
01225  */
01226 
01227   char errorStatus[50] = "";
01228 
01229   int numDatums = datumList.size();
01230 
01231   if( ( sourceIndex < 0 ) || ( sourceIndex >= numDatums ) )
01232     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01233   if( ( targetIndex < 0 ) || ( targetIndex >= numDatums ) )
01234     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01235 
01236   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
01237     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
01238 
01239   if( sourceIndex == targetIndex )
01240   {
01241     return new CartesianCoordinates( CoordinateType::geocentric, sourceX, sourceY, sourceZ );
01242   }
01243   else
01244   {
01245     CartesianCoordinates* wgs84CartesianCoordinates = geocentricShiftToWGS84( sourceIndex, sourceX, sourceY, sourceZ );
01246 
01247     CartesianCoordinates* targetCartesianCoordinates = geocentricShiftFromWGS84( wgs84CartesianCoordinates->x(), wgs84CartesianCoordinates->y(), wgs84CartesianCoordinates->z(), targetIndex );
01248 
01249     delete wgs84CartesianCoordinates;
01250 
01251     return targetCartesianCoordinates;
01252   }
01253 } 
01254 
01255 
01256 CartesianCoordinates* DatumLibraryImplementation::geocentricShiftFromWGS84( const double WGS84X, const double WGS84Y, const double WGS84Z, const long targetIndex )
01257 { 
01258 /*
01259  *  The function geocentricShiftFromWGS84 shifts a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative
01260  *  to WGS84 to a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative to the
01261  *  local datum referenced by index.
01262  *
01263  *  WGS84X        : X coordinate relative to WGS84                      (input)
01264  *  WGS84Y        : Y coordinate relative to WGS84                      (input)
01265  *  WGS84Z        : Z coordinate relative to WGS84                      (input)
01266  *  targetIndex   : Index of destination datum                          (input)
01267  *  targetX       : X coordinate relative to the destination datum      (output)
01268  *  targetY       : Y coordinate relative to the destination datum      (output)
01269  *  targetZ       : Z coordinate relative to the destination datum      (output)
01270  */
01271 
01272   char errorStatus[50] = "";
01273 
01274   int numDatums = datumList.size();
01275 
01276   if( ( targetIndex < 0 ) || ( targetIndex >= numDatums ) )
01277     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01278 
01279   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
01280     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
01281 
01282   Datum* localDatum = datumList[targetIndex];
01283   switch( localDatum->datumType() )
01284   {
01285     case DatumType::wgs72Datum:
01286     {
01287       CartesianCoordinates* wgs72CartesianCoordinates = geocentricShiftWGS84ToWGS72( WGS84X, WGS84Y, WGS84Z );
01288 
01289       return wgs72CartesianCoordinates;
01290     }
01291     case DatumType::wgs84Datum:
01292     {
01293       return new CartesianCoordinates( CoordinateType::geocentric, WGS84X, WGS84Y, WGS84Z );
01294     }
01295     case DatumType::sevenParamDatum:
01296     {
01297       SevenParameterDatum* sevenParameterDatum = ( SevenParameterDatum* )localDatum;
01298 
01299       double targetX = WGS84X - sevenParameterDatum->deltaX() - sevenParameterDatum->rotationZ() * WGS84Y
01300                  + sevenParameterDatum->rotationY() * WGS84Z - sevenParameterDatum->scaleFactor() * WGS84X;
01301 
01302       double targetY = WGS84Y - sevenParameterDatum->deltaY() + sevenParameterDatum->rotationZ() * WGS84X
01303                  - sevenParameterDatum->rotationX() * WGS84Z - sevenParameterDatum->scaleFactor() * WGS84Y;
01304 
01305       double targetZ = WGS84Z - sevenParameterDatum->deltaZ() - sevenParameterDatum->rotationY() * WGS84X
01306                  + sevenParameterDatum->rotationX() * WGS84Y - sevenParameterDatum->scaleFactor() * WGS84Z;
01307 
01308       return new CartesianCoordinates( CoordinateType::geocentric, targetX, targetY, targetZ );
01309     }
01310     case DatumType::threeParamDatum:
01311     {
01312       ThreeParameterDatum* threeParameterDatum = ( ThreeParameterDatum* )localDatum;
01313 
01314       double targetX = WGS84X - threeParameterDatum->deltaX();
01315       double targetY = WGS84Y - threeParameterDatum->deltaY();
01316       double targetZ = WGS84Z - threeParameterDatum->deltaZ();
01317 
01318       return new CartesianCoordinates( CoordinateType::geocentric, targetX, targetY, targetZ );
01319     }
01320     default:
01321       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::datumType );
01322   } 
01323 } 
01324 
01325 
01326 CartesianCoordinates* DatumLibraryImplementation::geocentricShiftToWGS84( const long sourceIndex, const double sourceX, const double sourceY, const double sourceZ )
01327 { 
01328 /*
01329  *  The function geocentricShiftToWGS84 shifts a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative
01330  *  to the datum referenced by index to a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in
01331  *  meters) relative to WGS84.
01332  *
01333  *  sourceIndex : Index of source datum                         (input)
01334  *  sourceX     : X coordinate relative to the source datum     (input)
01335  *  sourceY     : Y coordinate relative to the source datum     (input)
01336  *  sourceZ     : Z coordinate relative to the source datum     (input)
01337  *  WGS84X      : X coordinate relative to WGS84                (output)
01338  *  WGS84Y      : Y coordinate relative to WGS84                (output)
01339  *  WGS84Z      : Z coordinate relative to WGS84                (output)
01340  */
01341 
01342   char errorStatus[50] = "";
01343 
01344   int numDatums = datumList.size();
01345 
01346   if( ( sourceIndex < 0 ) || (sourceIndex > numDatums ) )
01347     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01348 
01349   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
01350     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
01351 
01352   Datum* localDatum = datumList[sourceIndex];
01353   switch( localDatum->datumType() )
01354   {
01355     case DatumType::wgs72Datum:
01356     {
01357       CartesianCoordinates* wgs84CartesianCoordinates = geocentricShiftWGS72ToWGS84( sourceX, sourceY, sourceZ );
01358 
01359       return wgs84CartesianCoordinates;
01360     }
01361     case DatumType::wgs84Datum:
01362     {
01363       return new CartesianCoordinates( CoordinateType::geocentric, sourceX, sourceY, sourceZ );
01364     }
01365     case DatumType::sevenParamDatum:
01366     {
01367       SevenParameterDatum* sevenParameterDatum = ( SevenParameterDatum* )localDatum;
01368 
01369       double wgs84X = sourceX + sevenParameterDatum->deltaX() + sevenParameterDatum->rotationZ() * sourceY
01370                  - sevenParameterDatum->rotationY() * sourceZ + sevenParameterDatum->scaleFactor() * sourceX;
01371 
01372       double wgs84Y = sourceY + sevenParameterDatum->deltaY() - sevenParameterDatum->rotationZ() * sourceX
01373                  + sevenParameterDatum->rotationX() * sourceZ + sevenParameterDatum->scaleFactor() * sourceY;
01374 
01375       double wgs84Z = sourceZ + sevenParameterDatum->deltaZ() + sevenParameterDatum->rotationY() * sourceX
01376                  - sevenParameterDatum->rotationX() * sourceY + sevenParameterDatum->scaleFactor() * sourceZ;
01377 
01378       return new CartesianCoordinates( CoordinateType::geocentric, wgs84X, wgs84Y, wgs84Z );
01379     }
01380     case DatumType::threeParamDatum:
01381     {
01382       ThreeParameterDatum* threeParameterDatum = ( ThreeParameterDatum* )localDatum;
01383 
01384       double wgs84X = sourceX + threeParameterDatum->deltaX();
01385       double wgs84Y = sourceY + threeParameterDatum->deltaY();
01386       double wgs84Z = sourceZ + threeParameterDatum->deltaZ();
01387 
01388       return new CartesianCoordinates( CoordinateType::geocentric, wgs84X, wgs84Y, wgs84Z );
01389     }
01390     default:
01391       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::datumType );
01392   } 
01393 } 
01394 
01395 
01396 GeodeticCoordinates* DatumLibraryImplementation::geodeticDatumShift( const long sourceIndex, const GeodeticCoordinates* sourceCoordinates,
01397                                        const long targetIndex )
01398 { 
01399 /*
01400  *  The function geodeticDatumShift shifts geodetic coordinates (latitude, longitude in radians
01401  *  and height in meters) relative to the source datum to geodetic coordinates
01402  *  (latitude, longitude in radians and height in meters) relative to the
01403  *  destination datum.
01404  *
01405  *  sourceIndex     : Index of source datum                               (input)
01406  *  sourceLongitude : Longitude in radians relative to source datum       (input)
01407  *  sourceLatitude  : Latitude in radians relative to source datum        (input)
01408  *  sourceHeight    : Height in meters relative to source datum           (input)
01409  *  targetIndex     : Index of destination datum                          (input)
01410  *  targetLongitude : Longitude in radians relative to destination datum  (output)
01411  *  targetLatitude  : Latitude in radians relative to destination datum   (output)
01412  *  targetHeight    : Height in meters relative to destination datum      (output)
01413  */
01414 
01415   long E_Index;
01416   double a;
01417   double f;
01418   char errorStatus[50] = "";
01419 
01420   double sourceLongitude = sourceCoordinates->longitude();
01421   double sourceLatitude = sourceCoordinates->latitude();
01422   double sourceHeight = sourceCoordinates->height();
01423 
01424   int numDatums = datumList.size();
01425 
01426   if( sourceIndex < 0 || sourceIndex >= numDatums )
01427     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01428   if( targetIndex < 0 || targetIndex >= numDatums )
01429     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01430 
01431   if( ( sourceLatitude < ( -90 * PI_OVER_180 ) ) || ( sourceLatitude > ( 90 * PI_OVER_180 ) ) )
01432     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::latitude );
01433   if( ( sourceLongitude < ( -PI )) || ( sourceLongitude > TWO_PI ) )
01434     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::longitude );
01435 
01436   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
01437     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
01438 
01439   Datum* sourceDatum = datumList[sourceIndex];
01440   Datum* targetDatum = datumList[targetIndex];
01441 
01442   if ( sourceIndex == targetIndex )
01443   { /* Just copy */
01444     return new GeodeticCoordinates(CoordinateType::geodetic, sourceLatitude, sourceLongitude, sourceHeight);
01445   }
01446   else
01447   {
01448     if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation )
01449     {
01450       if( sourceDatum->datumType() == DatumType::sevenParamDatum )
01451       {
01452         _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( sourceDatum->ellipsoidCode(), &E_Index );
01453         _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( E_Index, &a, &f );
01454 
01455       /*  if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( sourceDatum->ellipsoidCode(), &E_Index ) )
01456           errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;
01457         if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( E_Index, &a, &f ) )
01458           errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;*/
01459 
01460           Geocentric geocentricFromGeodetic( a, f );
01461          // geocentricErrorStatus = geocentricFromGeodetic.setParameters( a, f );
01462           CartesianCoordinates* sourceCartesianCoordinates = geocentricFromGeodetic.convertFromGeodetic( sourceCoordinates );
01463 
01464           if( targetDatum->datumType() == DatumType::sevenParamDatum )
01465           { /* Use 3-step method for both stages */
01466             CartesianCoordinates* targetCartesianCoordinates = geocentricDatumShift( sourceIndex, sourceCartesianCoordinates->x(), sourceCartesianCoordinates->y(), sourceCartesianCoordinates->z(), targetIndex );
01467 
01468             _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( targetDatum->ellipsoidCode(), &E_Index );
01469             _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( E_Index, &a, &f );
01470 
01471            /* if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( targetDatum->ellipsoidCode(), &E_Index ) )
01472               errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;
01473             if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( E_Index, &a, &f ) )
01474               errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;*/
01475 
01476             Geocentric geocentricToGeodetic( a, f );
01477          //   geocentricErrorStatus = geocentricToGeodetic.setParameters( a, f );
01478             GeodeticCoordinates* targetGeodeticCoordinates = geocentricToGeodetic.convertToGeodetic( targetCartesianCoordinates );
01479 
01480             delete targetCartesianCoordinates;
01481             delete sourceCartesianCoordinates;
01482 
01483             return targetGeodeticCoordinates;
01484           }
01485           else
01486           { /* Use 3-step method for 1st stage, Molodensky if possible for 2nd stage */
01487             CartesianCoordinates* wgs84CartesianCoordinates = geocentricShiftToWGS84( sourceIndex, sourceCartesianCoordinates->x(), sourceCartesianCoordinates->y(), sourceCartesianCoordinates->z() );
01488 
01489             long wgs84EllipsoidIndex;
01490             _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WE", &wgs84EllipsoidIndex );
01491             _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs84EllipsoidIndex, &a, &f );
01492 
01493             Geocentric geocentricToGeodetic( a, f );
01494             //geocentricErrorStatus = geocentricToGeodetic.setParameters( a, f );
01495             GeodeticCoordinates* wgs84GeodeticCoordinates = geocentricToGeodetic.convertToGeodetic( wgs84CartesianCoordinates );
01496 
01497             GeodeticCoordinates* targetGeodeticCoordinates = geodeticShiftFromWGS84( wgs84GeodeticCoordinates, targetIndex );
01498 
01499             delete wgs84GeodeticCoordinates;
01500             delete wgs84CartesianCoordinates;
01501 
01502             return targetGeodeticCoordinates;
01503           }
01504       }
01505       else if( targetDatum->datumType() == DatumType::sevenParamDatum )
01506       { /* Use Molodensky if possible for 1st stage, 3-step method for 2nd stage */
01507         GeodeticCoordinates* wgs84GeodeticCoordinates = geodeticShiftToWGS84( sourceIndex, sourceCoordinates );
01508 
01509         long wgs84EllipsoidIndex;
01510         _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WE", &wgs84EllipsoidIndex );
01511         _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs84EllipsoidIndex, &a, &f );
01512 
01513         Geocentric geocentricFromGeodetic( a, f );
01514      //   geocentricErrorStatus = geocentricFromGeodetic.setParameters( a, f );
01515         CartesianCoordinates* wgs84CartesianCoordinates = geocentricFromGeodetic.convertFromGeodetic( wgs84GeodeticCoordinates );
01516 
01517         CartesianCoordinates* targetCartesianCoordinates = geocentricShiftFromWGS84( wgs84CartesianCoordinates->x(), wgs84CartesianCoordinates->y(), wgs84CartesianCoordinates->z(), targetIndex );
01518 
01519         _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( targetDatum->ellipsoidCode(), &E_Index );
01520         _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( E_Index, &a, &f );
01521       /*  if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( targetDatum->ellipsoidCode(), &E_Index ) )
01522           errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;
01523         if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( E_Index, &a, &f ) )
01524           errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;*/
01525 
01526         Geocentric geocentricToGeodetic( a, f );
01527       //  geocentricErrorStatus = geocentricToGeodetic.setParameters( a, f );
01528         GeodeticCoordinates* targetGeodeticCoordinates = geocentricToGeodetic.convertToGeodetic( targetCartesianCoordinates );
01529 
01530         delete targetCartesianCoordinates;
01531         delete wgs84CartesianCoordinates;
01532         delete wgs84GeodeticCoordinates;
01533 
01534         return targetGeodeticCoordinates;
01535       }
01536       else
01537       { /* Use Molodensky if possible for both stages */
01538         GeodeticCoordinates* wgs84GeodeticCoordinates = geodeticShiftToWGS84( sourceIndex, sourceCoordinates );
01539 
01540         GeodeticCoordinates* targetGeodeticCoordinates = geodeticShiftFromWGS84( wgs84GeodeticCoordinates, targetIndex );
01541 
01542         delete wgs84GeodeticCoordinates;
01543 
01544         return targetGeodeticCoordinates;
01545       }
01546     }
01547     else
01548       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::ellipse );
01549   }
01550 } 
01551 
01552 
01553 GeodeticCoordinates* DatumLibraryImplementation::geodeticShiftFromWGS84( const GeodeticCoordinates* sourceCoordinates, const long targetIndex )
01554 { 
01555 /*
01556  *  The function geodeticShiftFromWGS84 shifts geodetic coordinates relative to WGS84
01557  *  to geodetic coordinates relative to a given local datum.
01558  *
01559  *    WGS84Longitude  : Longitude in radians relative to WGS84             (input)
01560  *    WGS84Latitude   : Latitude in radians relative to WGS84              (input)
01561  *    WGS84Height     : Height in meters  relative to WGS84                (input)
01562  *    targetIndex     : Index of destination datum                         (input)
01563  *    targetLongitude : Longitude in radians relative to destination datum (output)
01564  *    targetLatitude  : Latitude in radians relative to destination datum  (output)
01565  *    targetHeight    : Height in meters relative to destination datum     (output)
01566  *
01567  */
01568 
01569   double WGS84_a;   /* Semi-major axis of WGS84 ellipsoid in meters */
01570   double WGS84_f;   /* Flattening of WGS84 ellisoid                 */
01571   double a;         /* Semi-major axis of ellipsoid in meters       */
01572   double da;        /* Difference in semi-major axes                */
01573   double f;         /* Flattening of ellipsoid                      */
01574   double df;        /* Difference in flattening                     */
01575   double dx;
01576   double dy;
01577   double dz;
01578   long E_Index;
01579   char errorStatus[50] = "";
01580 
01581   double WGS84Longitude = sourceCoordinates->longitude();
01582   double WGS84Latitude = sourceCoordinates->latitude();
01583   double WGS84Height = sourceCoordinates->height();
01584 
01585   if( ( targetIndex < 0) || (targetIndex >= datumList.size() ) )
01586     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01587   if( ( WGS84Latitude < ( -90 * PI_OVER_180 ) ) || ( WGS84Latitude > ( 90 * PI_OVER_180 ) ) )
01588     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::latitude );
01589   if( ( WGS84Longitude < ( -PI ) ) || ( WGS84Longitude > TWO_PI ) )
01590     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::longitude );
01591 
01592   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
01593     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
01594 
01595   Datum* localDatum = datumList[targetIndex];
01596   switch( localDatum->datumType() )
01597   {
01598     case DatumType::wgs72Datum:
01599     {
01600       GeodeticCoordinates* targetGeodeticCoordinates = geodeticShiftWGS84ToWGS72( WGS84Longitude, WGS84Latitude, WGS84Height );
01601       return targetGeodeticCoordinates;
01602     }
01603     case DatumType::wgs84Datum:
01604     {
01605       return new GeodeticCoordinates( CoordinateType::geodetic, WGS84Longitude, WGS84Latitude, WGS84Height );
01606     }
01607     case DatumType::sevenParamDatum:
01608     case DatumType::threeParamDatum:
01609     {
01610       if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation )
01611       {
01612         _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( localDatum->ellipsoidCode(), &E_Index );
01613        _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( E_Index, &a, &f );
01614   /*      if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( localDatum->ellipsoidCode(), &E_Index ) )
01615           errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;
01616         if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( E_Index, &a, &f ) )
01617           errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;*/
01618 
01619         long wgs84EllipsoidIndex;
01620         _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WE", &wgs84EllipsoidIndex );
01621         _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs84EllipsoidIndex, &WGS84_a, &WGS84_f );
01622 
01623         if( ( localDatum->datumType() == DatumType::sevenParamDatum ) ||
01624             ( WGS84Latitude < ( -MOLODENSKY_MAX ) ) ||
01625             ( WGS84Latitude > MOLODENSKY_MAX ) )
01626         { /* Use 3-step method */
01627           Geocentric geocentricFromGeodetic( WGS84_a, WGS84_f );
01628          // geocentricErrorStatus = geocentricFromGeodetic.setParameters( WGS84_a, WGS84_f );
01629           CartesianCoordinates* wgs84CartesianCoordinates = geocentricFromGeodetic.convertFromGeodetic( sourceCoordinates );
01630 
01631           CartesianCoordinates* localCartesianCoordinates = geocentricShiftFromWGS84( wgs84CartesianCoordinates->x(), wgs84CartesianCoordinates->y(), 
01632                 wgs84CartesianCoordinates->z(), targetIndex );
01633 
01634           Geocentric geocentricToGeodetic( a, f );
01635          // geocentricErrorStatus = geocentricToGeodetic.setParameters( a, f );
01636           GeodeticCoordinates* targetGeodeticCoordinates = geocentricToGeodetic.convertToGeodetic( localCartesianCoordinates );
01637 
01638           delete localCartesianCoordinates;
01639           delete wgs84CartesianCoordinates;
01640 
01641           return targetGeodeticCoordinates;
01642         }
01643         else
01644         { /* Use Molodensky's method */
01645           da = a - WGS84_a;
01646           df = f - WGS84_f;
01647           dx = -( localDatum->deltaX() );
01648           dy = -( localDatum->deltaY() );
01649           dz = -( localDatum->deltaZ() );
01650 
01651           GeodeticCoordinates* targetGeodeticCoordinates = molodenskyShift( WGS84_a, da, WGS84_f, df, dx, dy, dz,
01652                            WGS84Longitude, WGS84Latitude, WGS84Height );
01653 
01654           return targetGeodeticCoordinates;
01655         }
01656       }
01657     }
01658     default:
01659       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::datumType );
01660   } 
01661 } 
01662 
01663 
01664 GeodeticCoordinates* DatumLibraryImplementation::geodeticShiftToWGS84( const long sourceIndex,  const GeodeticCoordinates* sourceCoordinates )
01665 { 
01666 /*
01667  *  The function geodeticShiftToWGS84 shifts geodetic coordinates relative to a given source datum
01668  *  to geodetic coordinates relative to WGS84.
01669  *
01670  *    sourceIndex     : Index of source datum                         (input)
01671  *    sourceLongitude : Longitude in radians relative to source datum (input)
01672  *    sourceLatitude  : Latitude in radians relative to source datum  (input)
01673  *    sourceHeight    : Height in meters relative to source datum     (input)
01674  *    WGS84Longitude  : Longitude in radians relative to WGS84        (output)
01675  *    WGS84Latitude   : Latitude in radians relative to WGS84         (output)
01676  *    WGS84Height     : Height in meters relative to WGS84            (output)
01677  *
01678  */
01679 
01680   double WGS84_a;   /* Semi-major axis of WGS84 ellipsoid in meters */
01681   double WGS84_f;   /* Flattening of WGS84 ellisoid                 */
01682   double a;         /* Semi-major axis of ellipsoid in meters       */
01683   double da;        /* Difference in semi-major axes                */
01684   double f;         /* Flattening of ellipsoid                      */
01685   double df;        /* Difference in flattening                     */
01686   double dx;
01687   double dy;
01688   double dz;
01689   long E_Index;
01690   char errorStatus[50] = "";
01691 
01692   double sourceLongitude = sourceCoordinates->longitude();
01693   double sourceLatitude = sourceCoordinates->latitude(); 
01694   double sourceHeight = sourceCoordinates->height();
01695 
01696   if( ( sourceIndex < 0 ) || ( sourceIndex >= datumList.size() ) )
01697     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01698   if( ( sourceLatitude < ( -90 * PI_OVER_180 ) ) || ( sourceLatitude > ( 90 * PI_OVER_180 ) ) )
01699     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::latitude );
01700   if( ( sourceLongitude < ( -PI ) ) || ( sourceLongitude > TWO_PI ) )
01701     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::longitude );
01702 
01703   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
01704     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
01705 
01706   Datum* localDatum = datumList[sourceIndex];
01707   switch( localDatum->datumType() )
01708   {
01709     case DatumType::wgs72Datum:
01710     { /* Special case for WGS72 */
01711       return geodeticShiftWGS72ToWGS84( sourceLongitude, sourceLatitude, sourceHeight );
01712     }
01713     case DatumType::wgs84Datum:
01714     {        /* Just copy */
01715       return new GeodeticCoordinates(CoordinateType::geodetic, sourceLongitude, sourceLatitude, sourceHeight);
01716     }
01717     case DatumType::sevenParamDatum:
01718     case DatumType::threeParamDatum:
01719     {
01720       if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation )
01721       {
01722         _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( localDatum->ellipsoidCode(), &E_Index );
01723         _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( E_Index, &a, &f );
01724 
01725     /*    if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( localDatum->ellipsoidCode(), &E_Index ) )
01726           errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;
01727         if( _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( E_Index, &a, &f ) )
01728           errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;*/
01729 
01730 //        if (!errorStatus)
01731 //        {
01732           if( ( localDatum->datumType() == DatumType::sevenParamDatum ) ||
01733               ( sourceLatitude < (-MOLODENSKY_MAX ) ) ||
01734               ( sourceLatitude > MOLODENSKY_MAX ) )
01735           { /* Use 3-step method */
01736             Geocentric geocentricFromGeodetic( a, f );
01737             //geocentricErrorStatus = geocentricFromGeodetic.setParameters( a, f );
01738             CartesianCoordinates* localCartesianCoordinates = geocentricFromGeodetic.convertFromGeodetic( sourceCoordinates );
01739 
01740             CartesianCoordinates* wgs84CartesianCoordinates = geocentricShiftToWGS84( sourceIndex, localCartesianCoordinates->x(), localCartesianCoordinates->y(), localCartesianCoordinates->z() );
01741 
01742             long wgs84EllipsoidIndex;
01743             _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WE", &wgs84EllipsoidIndex );
01744             _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs84EllipsoidIndex, &WGS84_a, &WGS84_f );
01745 
01746             Geocentric geocentricToGeodetic( WGS84_a, WGS84_f );
01747            // geocentricErrorStatus = geocentricToGeodetic.setParameters( WGS84_a, WGS84_f );
01748             GeodeticCoordinates* wgs84GeodeticCoordinates = geocentricToGeodetic.convertToGeodetic( wgs84CartesianCoordinates );
01749 
01750             delete wgs84CartesianCoordinates;
01751             delete localCartesianCoordinates;
01752 
01753             return wgs84GeodeticCoordinates;
01754           }
01755           else
01756           { /* Use Molodensky's method */
01757             long wgs84EllipsoidIndex;
01758             _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WE", &wgs84EllipsoidIndex );
01759             _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs84EllipsoidIndex, &WGS84_a, &WGS84_f );
01760 
01761             da = WGS84_a - a;
01762             df = WGS84_f - f;
01763             dx = localDatum->deltaX();
01764             dy = localDatum->deltaY();
01765             dz = localDatum->deltaZ();
01766 
01767             GeodeticCoordinates* wgs84GeodeticCoordinates = molodenskyShift( a, da, f, df, dx, dy, dz, sourceLongitude, sourceLatitude, sourceHeight );
01768 
01769             return wgs84GeodeticCoordinates;
01770           }
01771         }
01772    //   }
01773    //   else
01774    //     errorStatus |= DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR;
01775 
01776     }
01777     default:
01778       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::datumType );
01779   } 
01780 } 
01781 
01782 
01783 void DatumLibraryImplementation::retrieveDatumType( const long index, DatumType::Enum *datumType )
01784 { 
01785 /*
01786  *  The function retrieveDatumType returns the type of the datum referenced by
01787  *  index.
01788  *
01789  *  index     : The index of a given datum in the datum table.   (input)
01790  *  datumType : The type of datum referenced by index.           (output)
01791  *
01792  */
01793 
01794   if( index < 0 || index >= datumList.size() )
01795     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01796   else
01797     *datumType = datumList[index]->datumType();
01798 } 
01799 
01800 
01801 void DatumLibraryImplementation::validDatum( const long index, double longitude, double latitude, long *result )
01802 { 
01803 /*
01804  *  The function validDatum checks whether or not the specified location is within the
01805  *  validity rectangle for the specified datum.  It returns zero if the specified
01806  *  location is NOT within the validity rectangle, and returns 1 otherwise.
01807  *
01808  *   index     : The index of a given datum in the datum table      (input)
01809  *   latitude  : Latitude of the location to be checked in radians  (input)
01810  *   longitude : Longitude of the location to be checked in radians (input)
01811  *   result    : Indicates whether location is inside (1) or outside (0)
01812  *               of the validity rectangle of the specified datum   (output)
01813  */
01814 
01815   *result = 0;
01816 
01817   if( ( index < 0 ) || ( index >= datumList.size() ) )
01818     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
01819   if( ( latitude < MIN_LAT ) || ( latitude > MAX_LAT ) )
01820     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::latitude );
01821   if( ( longitude < MIN_LON ) || ( longitude > MAX_LON ) )
01822     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::longitude );
01823   
01824   Datum* datum = datumList[index];
01825 
01826   double west_longitude = datum->westLongitude();
01827   double east_longitude = datum->eastLongitude();
01828 
01829   /* The west and east longitudes may be in the range 0 to 360
01830      or -180 to 180, longitude is always in the -180 to 180 range
01831      Figure out which range west and east longitudes are in.
01832      If west and east are in the -180 to 180 range and west > east, put them in the 0 to 360 range and adjust longitude if
01833      necessary.     
01834      If west and east are in the 0 to 360 range and west > east, put them in the -180 to 180 range. If west < east, adjust 
01835      longitude to the 0 to 360 range
01836   */
01837   if( ( west_longitude < 0 ) || ( east_longitude < 0 ) )
01838   {
01839     if( west_longitude > east_longitude )
01840     {
01841       if( west_longitude < 0 )
01842         west_longitude += TWO_PI;
01843       if( east_longitude < 0 )
01844         east_longitude += TWO_PI;
01845       if( longitude < 0 )
01846         longitude += TWO_PI;
01847     }
01848   }
01849   else if( ( west_longitude > PI ) || ( east_longitude > PI ) )
01850   {
01851     if( west_longitude > east_longitude )
01852     {
01853       if( west_longitude > PI )
01854         west_longitude -= TWO_PI;
01855       if( east_longitude > PI )
01856         east_longitude -= TWO_PI;
01857     }
01858     else 
01859     {
01860       if( longitude < 0 )
01861         longitude += TWO_PI;
01862     }
01863   }
01864 
01865   if( ( datum->southLatitude() <= latitude ) &&
01866       ( latitude <= datum->northLatitude() ) &&
01867       ( west_longitude <= longitude ) &&
01868       ( longitude <= east_longitude ) )
01869   {
01870     *result = 1;
01871   }
01872   else
01873   {
01874     *result = 0;
01875   }
01876 } 
01877 
01878 
01879 void DatumLibraryImplementation::setEllipsoidLibraryImplementation( EllipsoidLibraryImplementation* __ellipsoidLibraryImplementation )
01880 {
01881 /*
01882  *  The function setEllipsoidLibraryImplementation sets the ellipsoid library information
01883  *  which is needed to create datums and calculate datum shifts.
01884  *
01885  *   __ellipsoidLibraryImplementation  : Ellipsoid library implementation      (input)
01886  *
01887  */
01888 
01889   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation = __ellipsoidLibraryImplementation;
01890 }
01891 
01892 
01893 /************************************************************************/
01894 /*                              PRIVATE FUNCTIONS     
01895  *
01896  */
01897 
01898 void DatumLibraryImplementation::loadDatums()
01899 { 
01900 /*
01901  * The function loadDatums creates the datum table from two external
01902  * files.  If an error occurs, the initialization stops and an error code is
01903  * returned.  This function must be called before any of the other functions
01904  * in this component.
01905  */
01906 
01907   long index = 0, i = 0;
01908   char *PathName = NULL;
01909   char* FileName7 = 0;
01910   FILE *fp_7param = NULL;
01911   FILE *fp_3param = NULL;
01912   char* FileName3 = 0;
01913   const int file_name_length = 20;
01914 
01915   Thread_Mutex datum_mutex;
01916   long mutex_error = Threads_Create_Mutex( &datum_mutex );
01917   if( !mutex_error )
01918     mutex_error = Threads_Lock_Mutex( datum_mutex );
01919 
01920   /*  Check the environment for a user provided path, else current directory;   */
01921   /*  Build a File Name, including specified or default path:                   */
01922 
01923   PathName = getenv( "MSPCCS_DATA" );
01924   if (PathName != NULL)
01925   {
01926     FileName7 = new char[ strlen( PathName ) + 13 ];
01927     strcpy( FileName7, PathName );
01928     strcat( FileName7, "/" );
01929   }
01930   else
01931   {
01932     FileName7 = new char[ file_name_length ];
01933     strcpy( FileName7, "../../data/" );
01934   }
01935   strcat( FileName7, "7_param.dat" );
01936 
01937   /*  Open the File READONLY, or Return Error Condition:                        */
01938 
01939   if (( fp_7param = fopen( FileName7, "r" ) ) == NULL)
01940   {
01941     delete [] FileName7;
01942     FileName7 = 0;
01943 
01944     char message[256] = "";
01945     strcpy( message, ErrorMessages::datumFileOpenError );
01946     strcat( message, ": 7_param.dat\n" );
01947   }
01948 
01949   if (PathName != NULL)
01950   {
01951     FileName3 = new char[ strlen( PathName ) + 13 ];
01952     strcpy( FileName3, PathName );
01953     strcat( FileName3, "/" );
01954   }
01955   else
01956   {
01957     FileName3 = new char[ file_name_length ];
01958     strcpy( FileName3, "../../data/" );
01959   }
01960   strcat( FileName3, "3_param.dat" );
01961 
01962   /*  Open the File READONLY, or Return Error Condition:                        */
01963 
01964   if (( fp_3param = fopen( FileName3, "r" ) ) == NULL)
01965   {
01966     delete [] FileName7;
01967     FileName7 = 0;
01968     delete [] FileName3;
01969     FileName3 = 0;
01970     
01971     char message[256] = "";
01972     strcpy( message, ErrorMessages::datumFileOpenError );
01973     strcat( message, ": 3_param.dat\n" );
01974     throw CoordinateConversionException( message );
01975   }
01976 
01977     /* WGS84 datum entry */
01978     datumList.push_back( new Datum( index, "WGE", "WE", "World Geodetic System 1984", DatumType::wgs84Datum, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, -PI, +PI, -PI / 2.0, +PI / 2.0, false ) );
01979     index ++;
01980 
01981 
01982     /* WGS72 datum entry */
01983     datumList.push_back( new Datum( index, "WGC", "WD", "World Geodetic System 1972", DatumType::wgs72Datum, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, -PI, +PI, -PI / 2.0, +PI / 2.0, false ) );
01984 
01985     index ++;
01986 
01987     datum7ParamCount = 0;
01988     /* build 7-parameter datum table entries */
01989     while ( !feof(fp_7param ) )
01990     {
01991       if ( datum7ParamCount < MAX_7PARAM )
01992       { 
01993         char code[DATUM_CODE_LENGTH];
01994 
01995         bool userDefined = false;
01996 
01997         if (fscanf(fp_7param, "%s ", code) <= 0)
01998           throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::datumFileParseError );
01999         else
02000         {
02001           if( code[0] == '*' )
02002           {
02003             userDefined = true;
02004             for( int i = 0; i < DATUM_CODE_LENGTH; i++ )
02005               code[i] = code[i+1];
02006           }
02007         }
02008 
02009         char name[DATUM_NAME_LENGTH];
02010         if (fscanf(fp_7param, "\"%32[^\"]\"", name) <= 0)
02011           name[0] = '\0';
02012 
02013         char ellipsoidCode[ELLIPSOID_CODE_LENGTH];
02014         double deltaX;
02015         double deltaY;
02016         double deltaZ;
02017         double rotationX;
02018         double rotationY;
02019         double rotationZ;
02020         double scaleFactor;
02021 
02022         if( fscanf( fp_7param, " %s %lf %lf %lf %lf %lf %lf %lf ",
02023                     ellipsoidCode,  &deltaX, &deltaY, &deltaZ, &rotationX, &rotationY, &rotationZ,  &scaleFactor ) <= 0 )
02024         {
02025           throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::datumFileParseError );
02026         }
02027         else
02028         { /* convert from degrees to radians */
02029 
02030           rotationX /= SECONDS_PER_RADIAN;
02031           rotationY /= SECONDS_PER_RADIAN;
02032           rotationZ /= SECONDS_PER_RADIAN;
02033           
02034           datumList.push_back( new SevenParameterDatum( index, code, ellipsoidCode, name, DatumType::sevenParamDatum, deltaX, deltaY, deltaZ, -PI, +PI, -PI / 2.0, +PI / 2.0,
02035                                                         rotationX, rotationY, rotationZ, scaleFactor, userDefined ) );
02036         }
02037         index++;
02038         datum7ParamCount++;
02039       }
02040       else
02041       {
02042         throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::datumOverflow );
02043       }
02044     }
02045     fclose( fp_7param );
02046 
02047     datum3ParamCount = 0;
02048 
02049     /* build 3-parameter datum table entries */
02050     while( !feof( fp_3param ) )
02051     {
02052       if( datum3ParamCount < MAX_3PARAM )
02053       { 
02054         char code[DATUM_CODE_LENGTH];
02055 
02056         bool userDefined = false;
02057 
02058         if( fscanf( fp_3param, "%s ", code ) <= 0 )
02059           throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::datumFileParseError );
02060         else
02061         {
02062           if( code[0] == '*' )
02063           {
02064             userDefined = true;
02065             for( int i = 0; i < DATUM_CODE_LENGTH; i++ )
02066               code[i] = code[i+1];
02067           }
02068         }
02069 
02070         char name[DATUM_NAME_LENGTH];
02071         if( fscanf( fp_3param, "\"%32[^\"]\"", name) <= 0 )
02072           name[0] = '\0';
02073 
02074         char ellipsoidCode[ELLIPSOID_CODE_LENGTH];
02075         double deltaX;
02076         double deltaY;
02077         double deltaZ;
02078         double sigmaX;
02079         double sigmaY;
02080         double sigmaZ;
02081         double eastLongitude;
02082         double westLongitude;
02083         double northLatitude;
02084         double southLatitude;
02085 
02086         if( fscanf( fp_3param, " %s %lf %lf %lf %lf %lf %lf %lf %lf %lf %lf ",
02087                     ellipsoidCode, &deltaX, &sigmaX, &deltaY, &sigmaY, &deltaZ, &sigmaZ, 
02088                     &southLatitude, &northLatitude, &westLongitude, &eastLongitude ) <= 0 )
02089         {
02090           throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::datumFileParseError );
02091         }
02092         else
02093         {
02094           southLatitude *= PI_OVER_180;
02095           northLatitude *= PI_OVER_180;
02096           westLongitude *= PI_OVER_180;
02097           eastLongitude *= PI_OVER_180;
02098 
02099           datumList.push_back( new ThreeParameterDatum( index, code, ellipsoidCode, name, DatumType::threeParamDatum, deltaX, deltaY, deltaZ, 
02100                                                         westLongitude, eastLongitude, southLatitude, northLatitude, sigmaX, sigmaY, sigmaZ, userDefined ) );
02101         }
02102 
02103         index++;
02104         datum3ParamCount++;
02105       }
02106       else
02107       {
02108         throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::datumOverflow );
02109       }
02110     }
02111     fclose( fp_3param );
02112 
02113   if( !mutex_error )
02114     mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex( datum_mutex );
02115   if( !mutex_error )
02116     Threads_Destroy_Mutex( datum_mutex );
02117 
02118   delete [] FileName7;
02119   FileName7 = 0;
02120   delete [] FileName3;
02121   FileName3 = 0;
02122 }
02123 
02124 
02125 void DatumLibraryImplementation::write3ParamFile()
02126 {
02127 /*
02128  *  The function write3ParamFile writes the 3 parameter datums in the datum list
02129  *  to the 3_param.dat file.
02130  */
02131 
02132   char datum_name[DATUM_NAME_LENGTH+2];
02133   char *PathName = NULL;
02134   char FileName[FILENAME_LENGTH];
02135   FILE *fp_3param = NULL;
02136 
02137   Thread_Mutex datum_mutex;
02138   long mutex_error = Threads_Create_Mutex( &datum_mutex );
02139   if( !mutex_error )
02140     mutex_error = Threads_Lock_Mutex( datum_mutex );
02141 
02142   /*output updated 3-parameter datum table*/
02143   PathName = getenv( "MSPCCS_DATA" );
02144   if (PathName != NULL)
02145   {
02146     strcpy( FileName, PathName );
02147     strcat( FileName, "/" );
02148   }
02149   else
02150   {
02151     strcpy( FileName, "../../data/" );
02152   }
02153   strcat( FileName, "3_param.dat" );
02154 
02155   if ((fp_3param = fopen(FileName, "w")) == NULL)
02156   { /* fatal error */
02157     if( !mutex_error )
02158       mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex( datum_mutex );
02159     if( !mutex_error )
02160       Threads_Destroy_Mutex( datum_mutex );
02161 
02162     char message[256] = "";
02163     strcpy( message, ErrorMessages::datumFileOpenError );
02164     strcat( message, ": 3_param.dat\n" );
02165     throw CoordinateConversionException( message );
02166   }
02167 
02168   /* write file */
02169   long index = MAX_WGS + datum7ParamCount;
02170   int size = datumList.size();
02171   while( index < size )
02172   {
02173     ThreeParameterDatum* _3parameterDatum = ( ThreeParameterDatum* )datumList[index];
02174     if( _3parameterDatum )
02175     {
02176       strcpy( datum_name, "\"" );
02177       strcat( datum_name, datumList[index]->name());
02178       strcat( datum_name, "\"" );
02179       if( _3parameterDatum->userDefined() )
02180         fprintf( fp_3param, "*");
02181 
02182       fprintf( fp_3param, "%-6s  %-33s%-2s %4.0f %4.0f %4.0f %4.0f %5.0f %4.0f %4.0f %4.0f %4.0f %4.0f \n",
02183                _3parameterDatum->code(),
02184                datum_name,
02185                _3parameterDatum->ellipsoidCode(),
02186                _3parameterDatum->deltaX(),
02187                _3parameterDatum->sigmaX(),
02188                _3parameterDatum->deltaY(),
02189                _3parameterDatum->sigmaY(),
02190                _3parameterDatum->deltaZ(),
02191                _3parameterDatum->sigmaZ(),
02192                ( _3parameterDatum->southLatitude() * _180_OVER_PI ),
02193                ( _3parameterDatum->northLatitude() * _180_OVER_PI ),
02194                ( _3parameterDatum->westLongitude() * _180_OVER_PI ),
02195                ( _3parameterDatum->eastLongitude() * _180_OVER_PI ) );
02196     }
02197 
02198     index++;
02199   }
02200 
02201   fclose( fp_3param );
02202 
02203   if( !mutex_error )
02204     mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex( datum_mutex );
02205   if( !mutex_error )
02206     Threads_Destroy_Mutex( datum_mutex );
02207 }
02208 
02209 
02210 void DatumLibraryImplementation::write7ParamFile()
02211 {
02212 /*
02213  *  The function write3ParamFile writes the 7 parameter datums in the datum list
02214  *  to the 7_param.dat file.
02215  */
02216 
02217   char datum_name[DATUM_NAME_LENGTH+2];
02218   char *PathName = NULL;
02219   char FileName[FILENAME_LENGTH];
02220   FILE *fp_7param = NULL;
02221 
02222   Thread_Mutex datum_mutex;
02223   long mutex_error = Threads_Create_Mutex( &datum_mutex );
02224   if( !mutex_error )
02225     mutex_error = Threads_Lock_Mutex( datum_mutex );
02226 
02227   /*output updated 7-parameter datum table*/
02228   PathName = getenv( "MSPCCS_DATA" );
02229   if (PathName != NULL)
02230   {
02231     strcpy( FileName, PathName );
02232     strcat( FileName, "/" );
02233   }
02234   else
02235   {
02236     strcpy( FileName, "../../data/" );
02237   }
02238   strcat( FileName, "7_param.dat" );
02239 
02240   if ((fp_7param = fopen(FileName, "w")) == NULL)
02241   { /* fatal error */
02242     if( !mutex_error )
02243       mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex( datum_mutex );
02244     if( !mutex_error )
02245       Threads_Destroy_Mutex( datum_mutex );
02246 
02247     char message[256] = "";
02248     strcpy( message, ErrorMessages::datumFileOpenError );
02249     strcat( message, ": 7_param.dat\n" );
02250     throw CoordinateConversionException( message );
02251   }
02252 
02253   /* write file */
02254   long index = MAX_WGS;
02255   int endIndex = datum7ParamCount + MAX_WGS;
02256   while( index < endIndex )
02257   {
02258     SevenParameterDatum* _7parameterDatum = ( SevenParameterDatum* )datumList[index];
02259     if( _7parameterDatum )
02260     {
02261       strcpy( datum_name, "\"" );
02262       strcat( datum_name, datumList[index]->name());
02263       strcat( datum_name, "\"" );
02264       if( _7parameterDatum->userDefined() )
02265         fprintf( fp_7param, "*");
02266 
02267       fprintf( fp_7param, "%-6s  %-33s%-2s  %4.0f  %4.0f  %4.0f % 4.3f % 4.3f % 4.3f   % 4.10f \n",
02268                _7parameterDatum->code(),
02269                datum_name,
02270                _7parameterDatum->ellipsoidCode(),
02271                _7parameterDatum->deltaX(),
02272                _7parameterDatum->deltaY(),
02273                _7parameterDatum->deltaZ(),
02274                _7parameterDatum->rotationX() * SECONDS_PER_RADIAN,
02275                _7parameterDatum->rotationY() * SECONDS_PER_RADIAN,
02276                _7parameterDatum->rotationZ() * SECONDS_PER_RADIAN,
02277                _7parameterDatum->scaleFactor() );
02278     }
02279 
02280     index++;
02281   }
02282 
02283   fclose( fp_7param );
02284 
02285   if( !mutex_error )
02286     mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex( datum_mutex );
02287   if( !mutex_error )
02288     Threads_Destroy_Mutex( datum_mutex );
02289 }
02290 
02291 
02292 GeodeticCoordinates* DatumLibraryImplementation::geodeticShiftWGS84ToWGS72( const double WGS84Longitude, const double WGS84Latitude, const double WGS84Height )
02293 { 
02294 /*
02295  *  The function geodeticShiftWGS84ToWGS72 shifts a geodetic coordinate (latitude, longitude in radians
02296  *  and height in meters) relative to WGS84 to a geodetic coordinate
02297  *  (latitude, longitude in radians and height in meters) relative to WGS72.
02298  *
02299  *  WGS84Longitude : Longitude in radians relative to WGS84    (input)
02300  *  WGS84Latitude  : Latitude in radians relative to WGS84     (input)
02301  *  WGS84Height    : Height in meters  relative to WGS84       (input)
02302  *  WGS72Longitude : Longitude in radians relative to WGS72    (output)
02303  *  WGS72Latitude  : Latitude in radians relative to WGS72     (output)
02304  *  WGS72Height    : Height in meters relative to WGS72        (output)
02305  */
02306 
02307   double Delta_Lat;
02308   double Delta_Lon;
02309   double Delta_Hgt;
02310   double WGS84_a;       /* Semi-major axis of WGS84 ellipsoid               */
02311   double WGS84_f;       /* Flattening of WGS84 ellipsoid                    */
02312   double WGS72_a;       /* Semi-major axis of WGS72 ellipsoid               */
02313   double WGS72_f;       /* Flattening of WGS72 ellipsoid                    */
02314   double da;            /* WGS72_a - WGS84_a                                */
02315   double df;            /* WGS72_f - WGS84_f                                */
02316   double Q;
02317   double sin_Lat;
02318   double sin2_Lat;
02319 
02320   long wgs84EllipsoidIndex;
02321   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WE", &wgs84EllipsoidIndex );
02322   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs84EllipsoidIndex, &WGS84_a, &WGS84_f );
02323 
02324   long wgs72EllipsoidIndex;
02325   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WD", &wgs72EllipsoidIndex );
02326   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs72EllipsoidIndex, &WGS72_a, &WGS72_f );
02327 
02328   da = WGS72_a - WGS84_a;
02329   df = WGS72_f - WGS84_f;
02330   Q = PI / 648000;
02331   sin_Lat = sin(WGS84Latitude);
02332   sin2_Lat = sin_Lat * sin_Lat;
02333 
02334   Delta_Lat = (-4.5 * cos(WGS84Latitude)) / (WGS84_a*Q)
02335               + (df * sin(2*WGS84Latitude)) / Q;
02336   Delta_Lat /= SECONDS_PER_RADIAN;
02337   Delta_Lon = -0.554 / SECONDS_PER_RADIAN;
02338   Delta_Hgt = -4.5 * sin_Lat + WGS84_a * df * sin2_Lat - da - 1.4;
02339 
02340   double wgs72Latitude = WGS84Latitude + Delta_Lat;
02341   double wgs72Longitude = WGS84Longitude + Delta_Lon;
02342   double wgs72Height = WGS84Height + Delta_Hgt;
02343 
02344   if (wgs72Latitude > PI_OVER_2)
02345     wgs72Latitude = PI_OVER_2 - (wgs72Latitude - PI_OVER_2);
02346   else if (wgs72Latitude < -PI_OVER_2)
02347     wgs72Latitude = -PI_OVER_2  - (wgs72Latitude + PI_OVER_2);
02348 
02349   if (wgs72Longitude > PI)
02350     wgs72Longitude -= TWO_PI;
02351   if (wgs72Longitude < -PI)
02352     wgs72Longitude += TWO_PI;
02353 
02354   return new GeodeticCoordinates(CoordinateType::geodetic, wgs72Longitude, wgs72Latitude, wgs72Height);
02355 } 
02356 
02357 
02358 GeodeticCoordinates* DatumLibraryImplementation::geodeticShiftWGS72ToWGS84( const double WGS72Longitude, const double WGS72Latitude, const double WGS72Height  )
02359 { 
02360 /*
02361  *  The function geodeticShiftWGS72ToWGS84 shifts a geodetic coordinate (latitude, longitude in radians
02362  *  and height in meters) relative to WGS72 to a geodetic coordinate
02363  *  (latitude, longitude in radians and height in meters) relative to WGS84.
02364  *
02365  *  WGS72Longitude : Longitude in radians relative to WGS72    (input)
02366  *  WGS72Latitude  : Latitude in radians relative to WGS72     (input)
02367  *  WGS72Height    : Height in meters relative to WGS72        (input)
02368  *  WGS84Longitude : Longitude in radians relative to WGS84    (output)
02369  *  WGS84Latitude  : Latitude in radians relative to WGS84     (output)
02370  *  WGS84Height    : Height in meters  relative to WGS84       (output)
02371  */
02372 
02373   double Delta_Lat;
02374   double Delta_Lon;
02375   double Delta_Hgt;
02376   double WGS84_a;       /* Semi-major axis of WGS84 ellipsoid               */
02377   double WGS84_f;       /* Flattening of WGS84 ellipsoid                    */
02378   double WGS72_a;       /* Semi-major axis of WGS72 ellipsoid               */
02379   double WGS72_f;       /* Flattening of WGS72 ellipsoid                    */
02380   double da;            /* WGS84_a - WGS72_a                                */
02381   double df;            /* WGS84_f - WGS72_f                                */
02382   double Q;
02383   double sin_Lat;
02384   double sin2_Lat;
02385 
02386   long wgs84EllipsoidIndex;
02387   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WE", &wgs84EllipsoidIndex );
02388   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs84EllipsoidIndex, &WGS84_a, &WGS84_f );
02389 
02390   long wgs72EllipsoidIndex;
02391   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WD", &wgs72EllipsoidIndex );
02392   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs72EllipsoidIndex, &WGS72_a, &WGS72_f );
02393 
02394   da = WGS84_a - WGS72_a;
02395   df = WGS84_f - WGS72_f;
02396   Q = PI /  648000;
02397   sin_Lat = sin(WGS72Latitude);
02398   sin2_Lat = sin_Lat * sin_Lat;
02399 
02400   Delta_Lat = (4.5 * cos(WGS72Latitude)) / (WGS72_a*Q) + (df * sin(2*WGS72Latitude)) / Q;
02401   Delta_Lat /= SECONDS_PER_RADIAN;
02402   Delta_Lon = 0.554 / SECONDS_PER_RADIAN;
02403   Delta_Hgt = 4.5 * sin_Lat + WGS72_a * df * sin2_Lat - da + 1.4;
02404 
02405   double wgs84Latitude = WGS72Latitude + Delta_Lat;
02406   double wgs84Longitude = WGS72Longitude + Delta_Lon;
02407   double wgs84Height = WGS72Height + Delta_Hgt;
02408 
02409   if (wgs84Latitude > PI_OVER_2)
02410     wgs84Latitude = PI_OVER_2 - (wgs84Latitude - PI_OVER_2);
02411   else if (wgs84Latitude < -PI_OVER_2)
02412     wgs84Latitude = -PI_OVER_2  - (wgs84Latitude + PI_OVER_2);
02413 
02414   if (wgs84Longitude > PI)
02415     wgs84Longitude -= TWO_PI;
02416   if (wgs84Longitude < -PI)
02417     wgs84Longitude += TWO_PI;
02418 
02419   return new GeodeticCoordinates(CoordinateType::geodetic, wgs84Longitude, wgs84Latitude, wgs84Height);
02420 } 
02421 
02422 
02423 CartesianCoordinates* DatumLibraryImplementation::geocentricShiftWGS84ToWGS72( const double X_WGS84, const double Y_WGS84, const double Z_WGS84 )
02424 { 
02425 /*
02426  *  The function geocentricShiftWGS84ToWGS72 shifts a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative
02427  *  to WGS84 to a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative to WGS72.
02428  *
02429  *  X_WGS84 : X coordinate relative to WGS84            (input)
02430  *  Y_WGS84 : Y coordinate relative to WGS84            (input)
02431  *  Z_WGS84 : Z coordinate relative to WGS84            (input)
02432  *  X       : X coordinate relative to WGS72            (output)
02433  *  Y       : Y coordinate relative to WGS72            (output)
02434  *  Z       : Z coordinate relative to WGS72            (output)
02435  */
02436 
02437   double a_72;   /* Semi-major axis in meters of WGS72 ellipsoid */
02438   double f_72;   /* Flattening of WGS72 ellipsoid      */
02439   double a_84;   /* Semi-major axis in meters of WGS84 ellipsoid */
02440   double f_84;   /* Flattening of WGS84 ellipsoid      */
02441 
02442   /* Set WGS84 ellipsoid params */
02443   long wgs84EllipsoidIndex;
02444   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WE", &wgs84EllipsoidIndex );
02445   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs84EllipsoidIndex, &a_84, &f_84 );
02446 
02447   Geocentric geocentric84( a_84, f_84 );
02448  // geocentricErrorStatus = geocentric84.setParameters( a_84, f_84 );
02449 
02450   GeodeticCoordinates* wgs84GeodeticCoordinates = geocentric84.convertToGeodetic( new CartesianCoordinates( CoordinateType::geocentric, X_WGS84, Y_WGS84, Z_WGS84 ) );
02451 
02452   GeodeticCoordinates* wgs72GeodeticCoordinates = geodeticShiftWGS84ToWGS72( wgs84GeodeticCoordinates->longitude(), wgs84GeodeticCoordinates->latitude(), wgs84GeodeticCoordinates->height() );
02453 
02454   /* Set WGS72 ellipsoid params */
02455   long wgs72EllipsoidIndex;
02456   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WD", &wgs72EllipsoidIndex );
02457   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs72EllipsoidIndex, &a_72, &f_72 );
02458 
02459   Geocentric geocentric72( a_72, f_72 );
02460   //geocentricErrorStatus = geocentric72.setParameters( a_72, f_72 );
02461 
02462   CartesianCoordinates* wgs72GeocentricCoordinates = geocentric72.convertFromGeodetic( wgs72GeodeticCoordinates );
02463 
02464   delete wgs72GeodeticCoordinates;
02465   delete wgs84GeodeticCoordinates;
02466 
02467   return wgs72GeocentricCoordinates;
02468 } 
02469 
02470 
02471 CartesianCoordinates* DatumLibraryImplementation::geocentricShiftWGS72ToWGS84( const double X, const double Y, const double Z )
02472 { 
02473 /*
02474  *  The function geocentricShiftWGS72ToWGS84 shifts a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative
02475  *  to WGS72 to a geocentric coordinate (X, Y, Z in meters) relative to WGS84.
02476  *
02477  *  X       : X coordinate relative to WGS72            (input)
02478  *  Y       : Y coordinate relative to WGS72            (input)
02479  *  Z       : Z coordinate relative to WGS72            (input)
02480  *  X_WGS84 : X coordinate relative to WGS84            (output)
02481  *  Y_WGS84 : Y coordinate relative to WGS84            (output)
02482  *  Z_WGS84 : Z coordinate relative to WGS84            (output)
02483  */
02484 
02485   double a_72;   /* Semi-major axis in meters of WGS72 ellipsoid */
02486   double f_72;   /* Flattening of WGS72 ellipsoid                */
02487   double a_84;   /* Semi-major axis in meters of WGS84 ellipsoid */
02488   double f_84;   /* Flattening of WGS84 ellipsoid                */
02489 
02490   /* Set WGS72 ellipsoid params */
02491   long wgs72EllipsoidIndex;
02492   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WD", &wgs72EllipsoidIndex );
02493   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs72EllipsoidIndex, &a_72, &f_72 );
02494 
02495   Geocentric geocentric72( a_72, f_72 );
02496  // geocentricErrorStatus = geocentric72.setParameters( a_72, f_72 );
02497   GeodeticCoordinates* wgs72GeodeticCoordinates = geocentric72.convertToGeodetic( new CartesianCoordinates( CoordinateType::geocentric, X, Y, Z ) );
02498 
02499   GeodeticCoordinates* wgs84GeodeticCoordinates = geodeticShiftWGS72ToWGS84( wgs72GeodeticCoordinates->longitude(), wgs72GeodeticCoordinates->latitude(), wgs72GeodeticCoordinates->height() );
02500 
02501   /* Set WGS84 ellipsoid params */
02502   long wgs84EllipsoidIndex;
02503   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidIndex( "WE", &wgs84EllipsoidIndex );
02504   _ellipsoidLibraryImplementation->ellipsoidParameters( wgs84EllipsoidIndex, &a_84, &f_84 );
02505 
02506   Geocentric geocentric84( a_84, f_84 );
02507   //geocentricErrorStatus = geocentric84.setParameters( a_84, f_84 );
02508   CartesianCoordinates* wgs84GeocentricCoordinates = geocentric84.convertFromGeodetic( wgs84GeodeticCoordinates );
02509 
02510   delete wgs84GeodeticCoordinates;
02511   delete wgs72GeodeticCoordinates;
02512 
02513   return wgs84GeocentricCoordinates;
02514 }
